Reviews.Title: “beautiful, old world, but rooms and bathrooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: Sue12959
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, old world charm, excellent location right next to the Pantheon and beautiful church, and close to many other attractions and shopping galore! Room service is very expensive, room and bathroom were so tiny I was a little claustrophobic, so luckily we only stayed two nights and spent our days touring or shopping..bed was quite firm so I didn't sleep well. The biggest disappointment was the room size but it was a short stay so nothing we couldn't handle. Staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. Linens were very nice and hotel was clean and full of old world charm. Terrace restaurant and bar were an added plus! Location was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Midweek break April 2012”
Reviews.Author: AROMANLOZ
Reviews.Content: Amazingly central location, Pantheon just a two minute walk, Trevi fountain,Spanish steps, Colloseum and the Vatican all within an easy twenty minute walk.The hotel itself is very classy with a beautifull Art Deco atrium roof in the lobby.On the actual hotel roof is a terrace restaurant and bar with the most spectacular views over Rome. The staff that we encountered were at all times very helpfull and available,Having read other reviews we asked for and got a high floor room overlooking the front, we were not dissapointed, Our room was on the small side, very clean and well presented, beautifull linen. The bathroom area was tightish but very well equipped and everything worked as it should. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room - dissapointed, TV seemed to be mostly pay-for , very few English speaking channels (4 to be precise, all news).Some of the woodwork around the windows could do with some small repair work, but nothing to write home about.Did not need the A/C but it worked fine. When windows closed at night no city sounds to be heard- good nights sleep. Breakfast was served in very nice surroundings,all you could want for, but I have to say, having stayed at a lot of 4/5 star hotels it was on the expensive side. Have read reviews that people found the lfts not to be good, they were slightly on the small side but clean and worked very well. The overall impression that the hotel gives is very good and well worth its starring. Travel time from airport Leo Da Vinci to hotel was about 35-40 mins, Rome has good private taxi service, expect to pay about 80 euro for the round trip (Merc E class). If returning to central Rome I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sergiotrip75
Reviews.Content: A few steps from the Pantheon this hotel is within 500 metres from most places worth sightseeing... We had a room (though ours was the cheapest available in the hotel) with a splendid view on the roofs of the city, the sun poured into the room in the morning. The bathroom was tiny, one people at a time. Breakfast was charged 35 euros (!), but there are many places around where you can have one for a few euros. On the whole really good if you don't use the minibar or the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Preved_Medved
Reviews.Content: The worst 5-star experience in Europe. The worst caprese from room service in my life (btw costs Euro 30). No charm, just old, tired and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Claire11111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group of friends for a girls weekend in Rome. A central hotel, situated right by the Pantheon (which was a stunning building to visit). This hotel is not cheap but offers great quality if you are looking for some luxury. We had a couple of minor glitches with items in our room but these were sorted immediately. I shared a three-bed room. The third bed was a sturdy, glorified camp-bed but was apparently comfortable according to my friend. The double bed was roomy and very comfortable. We chose to eat out at many local restaurants and so only ate breakfast in the hotel. Breakfast was good quality with lots of choice. All the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The barman, Fabio, was lovely and served our group really well when we returned from our meals out. The early evening cocktails we had on the roof terrace were lovely but watch out as all the drinks in this hotel are very expensive. €12 for a limoncello!! All in all a great find and suited our needs well.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bonissim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for walking to all the wonderful sites of Rome. The cobbled streets fit in well with the general ambience but do make walking a little more difficult and tiring. It is therefore important that you rest well, and you can at the Minerve. The beds are so comfortable with good quality linen. We had a deluxe room, booked at the advance purchase rate, together with a promotion of 15% discount on best available daily rate, so felt as if we had a good deal. Our room was well designed, plenty of wardrobe space, bathroom was adequate but perhaps a little cold. There was a large radiator in the bathroom but it was not working. Two bottles of mineral water were supplied every day. There was some renovation taking place in the hotel but it was not a problem. Being March, we chose not to eat at the Roof Garden Restaurant, preferring to wait until the barmy evenings of summer when it is at its best. In the bar a pianist was playing sometimes and you always receive some nibbles to enjoy with your drink. The staff are very polite and helpful and I will always choose to stay at La Minerve.

Reviews.Title: “" A Good Location"”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: Although I have been to Italy before I have never been to Rome so I was at a loss of where to book. I went to a web site I have used in the past called luxurygroup.com. The hotel was listed on their site so I booked it. The hotel is in the heart of Rome, the hotel is sophisticated, luxurious and cozy. Although my stay was only a few days I had a delightful time.

Reviews.Title: “More good than not so good”
Reviews.Author: Lavinia02
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just 1 night here, at the recommendation of friends who have stayed many times before - and would have graded it 3.5 (good) rather than average had there been an option to do so Best features are the location (although the taxi driver had diffculty finding it - so better to have precise directions) and the roof top restaurant Check in was smooth and efficient The lifts were tiny (holding 4 max) - and not recommended for anyone who is claustophobic! We were underwhelmed (indeed somewhat disappointed) upon seeing our room. It was clean, modern and high ceiled but certainly "compact" and looked out over an interior well facing into other rooms opposite. Wooden floors which are no doubt cool in summer but seemed rather hard underfoot in the middle of winter! The bathroom was very compact - just about large enough to fit everything in - with hardly any room to emerge from the shower (over the bath) between the edge of the shower door and the edge of the basin! Hand held shower (which I prefer) Towels were good quality and fluffy with robes provided - and there were a few bathroom goodies as well Nice quality linen on the bed - and a pillow menu Room had kettle (but only 1 mug - 2 Tea bags, 2 coffees and no biscuits) - iron and ironing boad and trouser press. Mini bar rather uninteresting - and no water supplied. TV had English sports channels - but we were unable to find an English news channel (although our friends seemed to have one) Bedroom lighting not as bright as we would have liked Room was very stuffy overnight so we turned on the a/c which was rather noisy - and ineffective (despite it being February!) All the staff we encountered were delightful - although we were rather surprised to find there were several staff in the roof top restaurant who spoke very little English and we had considerable difficulty in ordering our drinks! The gin and tonics arrived with "full strength" rather than slimline tonic - and when the rest of our group arrived, it proved impossible to order a Southern comfort (we gave up on this one!) and the (2 rather than 3) Ameretto and cokes arrived with "full strength" as opposed to diet coke. We didn't complain as we were amused rather than anything else - but the English lady sitting on the adjacent table was clearly extremely angry at having to wait so long for her order of a glass of wine and she took herself downstairs to the bar, carrying it upstairs herself! The restaurant itself is super - no doubt great ambience and views in the summer (although inevitably not quite so great in February with the roof on and sides down) and I'm sure we'll be back. Service was quite slow - although once again we didn't mind as we weren't in a rush - and plenty of bread was served. And the food was worth waiting for. The bar downstairs was pleasant and drinks/coffees were efficiently served with generous dishes of complimentary chocs and biscuits which were most welcome! A little background music might have soothed the atmosphere somewhat So not perfect but not at all bad - and we expect to return - but hope next time we might be rewarded with a better room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: Todstours
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have never stayed at the Grande Hotel de la Minerve. Too expensive for our travel budget, though our friends have stayed there and they recommend it highly. We have, however, enjoyed the rooftop bar when we are in Rome. In my opinion, this is one of the best rooftop bars in Europe. Catch the sunset over Rome while looking over the Pantheon, drinking martinis and listening to live music....well, it's a pretty cool scene. The staff is friendly and attentive. The drinks are a bit pricey, but you just can't beat the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: PabloSanJuan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 12/28/2011 to 1/07/2012 it is a very nice hotel but expensive, the best part is the location very close to the Pantheon, but our rooms were 340.00 euros/night and they were small rooms. Any drink or food at the hotel was too expensive so we did not try any. Service was excellent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A grande hotel”
Reviews.Author: s p
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great hotel that overlooked the piazza. We had the junior suite which is well appointed as expected for the price and service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Hotel Minerva - Rome in Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: Alanah988
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited the roof terrace in this hotel after a long day doing the sights. To our utter dispair we were treated so badly I am now prompted to write a review so that I can save other visitors from the dispectable and shameful behaviour of the staff on the roof terrace. My friend ordered a Singapore Gin Sling and I ordered a Bloody Mary. My friends drink was utterly revolting. God only knows what it was made from! We doubted if there was alcohol in it. My drink was served up with so much chilli it practically burned my mouth. I returned the drink but the new drink served to me had no alcohol - either Gin or Vodka in it at all. The staff here are arrogant and do not deserve to have a job. They also charged us over £100 to add insult to injury. If this hotel was the last one in Rome we would not use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better...”
Reviews.Author: Marchetta01
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Hotel Minerva for 14 years. My last visit in November, 2011 was excellent. This hotel is not resting on past glory, it is making itself better. The staff was excellent, the room updated, and the breakfast buffet completely revamped and wonderful. I will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A_Light_Sleeper
Reviews.Content: Imagine walking out of the front door of your hotel and seeing that you are a block from the Pantheon. Probably just another day to a local, but incredible for a tourist. In addition to the location, the staff are friendly, speak English, and are attentive. There is a rooftop bar to go to to see the sunset over the rooftops of all that is Rome. The rooms are spacious and appealing to weary tourists, and the restaurant is very good. Be sure to admire all of the Murano Glass works that surround you in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel experience was not better than a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: liapa
Reviews.Content: Other than location we didnt enjoy the experience at the hotel. Especially for the price or the hightened expectation of a 5-star hotel. We wanted to warn other travellers, as it was a very unusual 5 start hotel, nothing was really living up to that quality. There was not much of client service orientation, just rather indifferent attitude, which you may find in a 3 star hotel (in fact a bit worse than our stay few years ago in a 3-star hotel). We were surprised that common areas were not maintained that well either. Rooms were small and just ok. Location is excellent as it is next to Pantheon, but I am still surprised that a hotel can get such rating for location only. I would not have stayed and would not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here because of its location”
Reviews.Author: tunkeyandthemonkey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the hotel multiple times, typically annually, so this being our 5th trip, we knew what to expect. This is the first time I have read the trip advisor comments and unfortunately many of them resonate. We visit Rome to walk, not spend time in the hotel. Because of the location this makes each short trip a joy. The comments on the rooms and food are all spot on. We have stayed in a great room with a balcony overlooking the square/elephant. In contrast the classic room we stayed in was pretty awful. We returned yesterday and I fear that will be our last trip to GHdlM. To be great they need to invest in the hotel and the facilities. The gym for example is dark and small. The breakfast is not "four seasons" standards though the price is. Final note, whilst in the reply the food bad beverage manager commented that the roof top bar only closes 3 times a year, imagine my diassapointment that it was closed for a christining on Saturday night. Clearly it's not all bad, but it is important to understand that the big draw is location. Trip advisor comments give a good reflection of what I have seen for a number of years. I will stop recommending hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not so special”
Reviews.Author: Sjtsal
Reviews.Content: We just stayed two nights at this hotel. It was not very charming and we looked out at a dirty alley and an dirty rear doors of another building The bathroom was quite small The front desk people were great and the breakfast was delicious Make sure you ask for a room in the front and on a high floor

Reviews.Title: “Posh Hotel Very Good Location ...”
Reviews.Author: plane_cowboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. The front desk staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the bed linen smells fresh, toilet is well stocked, the towels are white and fluffy and the location of the Hotel is second to none, just around the corner from the Pantheon with easy reach to restaurants, Spanish steps and the lovely Trevi Fountain. The lifts are a wee bit small but still all right. A traditional legend holds that if visitors throw a coin into the fountain you will return to Rome one day it is supposed to be for "good luck", Despite being the heart of Rome you will find a very good selection of Pizza and Pasta places and most important ... not too expensive ( Pizza already for EUR9.00)

Reviews.Title: “Roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: gsp100677
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at this hotel, but came to the roof terrace bar for a drink. Excellent, friendly service. Well mixed cocktails, and good selection of wines & fizz. A little on the pricey side, but not unexpected for this type of hotel and quality. Fantastic views in all directions. Well worth a visit for an after dinner drink, but was starting to get too cold for it without a jumper/jacket when we visited in mid-October.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: giorgiadettoni
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is expensive "YES"..but worth every cent, if you are making your stay a special occasion in Rome, please consider the Minerva, it is an outstanding property, fantastic location, just around the corner from the Pantheon(we could see it clearly from our window). The rooms are generous by European standard, all mod cons, great service, really lovely. We had an error occur while checking in..and the manager could not be helpful enough..we received an upgrade for the trouble. Please consider this hotel, you wont be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “very good location - worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Sim0ne1971
Reviews.Content: I`ve been to Gran Hotel de la Minerva last july with my husband and 2 children aged 9 and 11. The location is really great - a few steps away from the Pantheon, and a walking distance from a handful of Rome touristic sites. We stayed in 2 connecting rooms, fully refurbished, big bathrooms, good showers, scenic views from our windows over Piazza de la Minerva and Le elefantino. Continental breakfast is pricey, but there are many options right outside the hotel. The staff was helpfull when I needed, (but I speak italian), A good experience, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SophieConcord
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Minerve hotel several times now, primarily due to its amazing location and its fun rooftop bar. This stay we were given a really nice room with interior ,quiet , balcony (#449) , king bed, good size room and nice marble bath. Beautiful bedding and nice bathroom supplies. Sadly, the rooftop bar we anticipated was closed for a party so we chose to eat at their dining tables. Pricey meal, not as good a value as the bar, nor was food noticeably sophisticated compared to all the good local restaurants. Skip the meal and wait for the sunset rooftop bar experience. Staff was pleasant, rooms clean, hallway rugs need updating, but overall, the ability to walk to the Pantheon with cappucinos on the square, and on to Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, and all the alleyways to Forum or Piazza di Spagna make it a treat.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the best hotel we have stayed in while travelling anywhere in Europe. Not only is it central (backs onto the Pantheon) but the interior decore and charm of this beautiful hotel are just outstanding. The room we had was magic. The desk staff, hotel staff and hosuekeeping staff were all polite and any problems we had (albeit not worth writing about) were resolved immediately. Our biggest disappointment was probably our last night there when we booked for dinner at their rooftop bar and restaurant. The food and drinks were great but the ambience was a bit hit and miss. The piano player was intermittent with the music but not an issue. Our main disappointment was with one of the waitresses. She was just rude. ignorant and had attitude like she did not want to be there. But that is a minor issue to whole experienc of staying in this grand hotel. If we are back in Rome this is the place we will be staying at again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: jba400
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not cheap, but it was well worth the approx $250+ we paid for each night. The location is perfect -- walkable to the coliseum, trevi fountain, spanish steps and piazza navona. If it wasn't so hot, we could have also walked to the Vatican. Our room was very large and comfortable -- our friends staying at different hotels couldnt' get over the size. The staff was very accommodating -- offering suggestions for meals and helping us book restaurant and train reservations. Would definitely stay here again. Be sure to go up to the roof one night for drinks -- we enjoyed a great sunset, amazing view and live music

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BridgetMaryG
Reviews.Content: Myself & my daughter stayed in the hotel for 3 nights we had requested a deluxe twin bedded room,on arrival the room was set up with a double bed and not twin beds as requested. This in itself was a small issue, but the lack of printed information material in the room was really disappointing and when we requested same we had to go to the concierge to collect tour information that he had underneath his desk - in a 5 star hotel this information should be located in each room or at least on show in the lobby area surely - we also asked him to recommend some good restraurants in the area which he declined to do. First impressions are so important but for the above reasons this hotel failed to impress -

Reviews.Title: “Check in&Check out”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: STRUCTURE: in the city center with no landscape, indifferent to the palace without any particular value LOBBYING: dark, foul smell at the entrance, no help with your luggage, annoying staff at the reception, a lift for up to two people without luggage, hospital-style corridors sad, entrance doors to rooms-style cruise ship, abandoned trolleys in corridors. ROOMS: cigarette smell in the room, on the couch and bed sheets, dust on the bedside tables, three star hotel furniture, bathroom not working RESTAURANT: not tried PERSONAL: annoying, not to meet any customer demand, sometimes rude and definitely not professional What I disliked: atmosphere, decor, staff OVERALL: I left the hotel after an hour as unhappy paying the entire night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cherole
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 1 night post-cruise. It was a fantastic location and a beatiful hotel. Great location near Pantheon with walking distance to sites, restaurants, etc. Excellent staff. The room was lovely and spacious. The bathroom was a little odd in terms of shape & space and could use some updates, but excellent shower, etc. Bed was comfy with nice bedding & pillows. Do not miss the rooftop bar. Nice views, accomodating bartender. Was no problem to grab a cab in the a.m. to get to the airport without pre-planning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CraigVan
Reviews.Content: Recently stay at the hotel just for a long weekend getaway. You can not beat the location as far as I am concerned. Walking distance to everything we wanted to see in a very condensed site seeing tour. We were able to walk about 20 minutes to the Vatican and then turn around the next day and about 15 minutes to the Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain and the Piazza Navona all within minutes. The hotel staff is great they are very helpful with anything you may need. Didn't eat at any of the restaurants because we were always out walking. The rooftop bar is nice to just sit and relax after walking all day and look out over the city night sky.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EricaNYC22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January. The rooms were clean, hotel is pretty & it is in a great location - right next to Pantheon. Some of the staff is more friendly than others. **Tip - ask to see your rooms before you check in. We had 2 rooms side by side & there was a considerable size difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great rooftop area”
Reviews.Author: 2VAGuys
Reviews.Content: We love the location of this hotel within the heart of historic Roma. Three minute walk from the Pantheon, five minutes from Piazza Navona and probably no more than ten minutes from the Spanish Steps area. The one downside was that our room was incredibly small but it was serviceable. The rooftop bar is wonderful. The views are outstanding - though the drinks are very expensive. The view down upon the roof of the Pantheon made it seem worth the price of the drinks. Breakfast was good but incredibly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: KBudz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing. It is beautiful and the rooms are spacious. The breakfast is great. The service is friendly, helpful and personal. The staff was very helpful in arranging my tour pickup coordination. It is right across from the Pantheon, and a few minute walk from Navona Piazza. Trevi Fountain is nearby. Since it is right by the Pantheon, you can always find it on a map! Five star accommodations and service.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SueWithaView
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times for work purposes. This hotel is in an amazing location; right beside the Pantheon and therefore the Piazza della Rotunda. This is a buzzing square with bars and restaurants where you can sit and look at the Pantheon; 2,000 years of history staring at you in the face. The little streets winding away from here offer cheaper options for food and drink with many churches on your way. The hotel has a wonderful doorman called Paul who seems to have been there forever. He always greets with the same friendly face. The reception hall and lounge has a beautiful glass ceiling, so peaceful and cool to sit underneath. The rooms are a little old, but very clean with a true Italian feel. The roof bar and restaurant offers a peaceful and select place to dine but is obviously rather expensive. The concierge is full of good recommendations with ready maps, as always, to help. I could never tire of staying here as I said previously, such a great location; you can walk to any of the great Roman 'must-do's' from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but hotel rooms look tired”
Reviews.Author: Ritalondra
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not what you would expect from a Five star hotel. They are quite tired looking and are in need of refurbishment. We stayed here four years ago and the rooms were impeccable. Now there are stains on the walls, carpet and plenty of scratches on the furniture. Also the grout in the bathroom needs changing. Staff is amazing though, very helpful and friendly. The concierge really knows his stuff. Five star staff.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would highly recommend it!"”
Reviews.Author: Debbydoo3115
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not only beautiful with a wonderful, attentive and friendly staff, but it was in a great location. When we were tired from sightseeing, we had only a short walk to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona for food and shopping. Although the hotel was full, we hardly ever heard another person at night.

Reviews.Title: “Location could not be beat. It felt like I was dreaming!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBradley
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! The location can not be beat. We were smack dab in the middle of Rome and we walked everywhere, except to the Colosseum. The Pantheon is right in front of this hotel and tons of restaurants are right there in the square with lots of live entertainment; loads of good Italian food and of course Gelato ice cream! We stayed in 2 luxurious rooms. One extremely large and the other was very spacious. I am not sure of the exact dimentions. When I saw some of the negative reviews on TripAdvisor I am guessing those people stayed in small rooms. I did take a look at some smaller rooms while we were there. One of our rooms had a sofa bed so our kids all slept in "our" room and the extra room down the hall pretty much went to waste. So about the hotel.... sometimes I like to break it down to the good; the bad and the ugly. Away we go! The good This is hands down the best location, and I am pretty sure the best hotel in this location. The rooms are nicely decorated The bedrooms are spacious We had music below our window everynight from the locals. Everything from beautiful singing, accordion playing, guitar playing and more. If we closed our windows it was pretty quiet, but we loved keeping them open. The room had nice furniture and great amenities. Of course we had robes, slippers, and nice European toiletries and soaps. The baths were very spacious and the towels were bath sheets. The bedroom that didn't occupy our family I preferred to shower in as there was a large window that opened up and you could hear the locals below. It was kinda dreamy. Many times on our visit we felt that it was dream like. So wonderful! Overall the staff was polite and helpful with a few exceptions. The hotel welcomed us with treats for all of us. The bad The Internet connection was by wire not wireless and it was down while we stayed there. We had hoped for connecting rooms but unfortunately the only connecting rooms were small. However the rooms they put us in were very large! A big thank you for that. The pillows and bed could have been more comfy. The bed was large and the linens soft but the matress itself wasn't that comfortable and the pillows were not soft enough for me. The Ugly When we were checking out, we were paying our final bill. The rooms were prepaid so only an airport transfer was left to pay; however the desk person insisted we owed additional taxes on our stay. We had paid over $400 in taxes for 4 nights on-line in advance and our receipt showed we had paid in full so I argued they must be confused and why was this so called tax never mentioned to me at check in when I confirmed all was prepaid and my credit card was put down only for incidentals such as mini bar or room service etc. Anyway after threatening to fish my receipt out of my packed luggage in the car waiting to take my family to the airport the receptionist "waived" the fee or as he called it "the tax". If there truly was an additional tax why wouldn't they include it in the original price of taxes and fees or at least tell you in someway upfront that you have additional money to pay but at the last second as you are rushing out the door? That is just wrong and tacky. All in all this hotel is great. It is closer to 5 stars then 4 but because of the ugliness at the end; I am giving it a 4. Five star hotels don't do that stuff. I would definitely stay at this hotel again though. I loved it. Please let me know if this review was helpful by checking that little box. It makes me feel good that I am not wasting my time doing all this typing. Also, sorry for any typos. I've got a toddler on the right of me as I type.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: Rejse1234
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location. Almost everything is in walking distance from this hotel. Our room was facing Piazza Minerve and Pantheon, and it was so beautiful. Do not go to the Roof-garden to eat. It was overpriced and not good. But the view from the roof-garden is out of this world.. Go to the roof-garden for an ice-coffe or softdrinks in the afternoon instead. You have it almost to our self, and the view is the same!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: JNMarr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights as part of a small group tour at the end of May. We had a large, beautiful room with two double beds. There was also a sofa and chair and a flat screen TV. The bathroom was also beautiful. The key card could be a bit of challenge to use until we got the knack! The doormen were so friendly and helpful and gave us great advice and directions. Breakfast was included in our package and it was a delicious buffet - the walnut bread was a special treat. Cappuccino was delicious and they were happy to bring two or three if we asked! The chandelier and sconces in the restaurant were spectacular floral Venetian glass - just stunning. The hostess and the servers were very pleasant. My only unfulfilled wish is free internet in the room. However, there is free wireless in the lobby and in the salons off the lobby, so I set myself up at a comfortable desk and used my netbook. There is also a computer for guest use off the lobby and it is very fast. The location is fantastic and the Pantheon is right outside the front doors. You can walk to so many interesting sights. In fact, it's much easier and quicker to walk instead of taking a cab! I would return to the hotel in a minute - we loved our stay. The rooftrop bar is delightful and there are great views. However, the drinks are VERY expensive - I did not order any myself, but one of my travel mates told me that two martinis cost her 38 euros.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good service, some refreshing useful”
Reviews.Author: claudiac67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve with my mother for four nights in early June 2011. The hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance from many attractions and beautiful spots. Reception staff is extremely helpful and kind. Beds are very confortable and the bathroom of our room, even if small, had all that was needed, including luxury toiletries. The corridors at the floors of the rooms have however a carpet that would need a very strong cleaning or replacing as there is a stuffy smell. The walls of the first room we were given would not mind a brush of paint. Overall, however, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TxakurGomez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally overpriced. It is very well situated in the heart of the old rome, and the bar at the terrace is great; but thst´s it! The rooms are quite small for a 5* and very dark. It is outrageous how much they charge for a night! I do not recommend it. BTW, horrible breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: euronautix
Reviews.Content: The location behind the Pantheon is unbelievable. Wonderful. But the Hotel is not a 5 Star Hotel. The rooms are prepared without any care. A little bit of Touristic touch..... but the location outshine this details ... Roof Garden Bar is adorable

Reviews.Title: “Got the old Tourist Song and Dance - Never again”
Reviews.Author: Santino49
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this "5 Star" "Business Hotel" with a confirmed, prepaid, nonrefundable confirmation for a non-smoking room. They first stuck us in a "Suite" that stank of old Marlboros and had a set of matches and ashtray on every table. The clerk explained that it was a nonsmoking room, but someone must have asked for ashtrays and the hotel really has no control over this, yada yada yada. They apologized and stuck us in a sprayed down smoking room, once again explaining that it was no different than the rooms that actually had a "NON SMOKING ROOM" sign posted at the door. FINALLY, after three iterations, we got the room we had PAID FOR IN ADVANCE. Clearly, they were trying to foist off their stinky rooms on the unsuspecting naive Americans. Later we became familiar with the cozy relationship between the staff and the various transportation companies around town. Finally, at checkout there was a substantial charge on my bill which clearly belonged to someone else. Could have been a mistake, but after our previous experience, I wasn't so sure. This hotel is clearly aimed toward people traveling on some else's dime (hence "Business Hotel") I found it to be overpriced, a bit run down, and didn't trust them at all. Never again. I may look like a rube tourist, but after 20 trips to Italy, I'm not. There are plenty of hotels in t he neighborhood where you'll be treated much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it even at a discount”
Reviews.Author: JenBarnett
Reviews.Content: I am going to compare this place to other 5 star hotels in major cities, so the standards are high. If they don’t want such high standards to be judged against, they should not present themselves as a 5 star hotel. I’ll present the pros and cons so that you can decide if this is right for you, based on what is important to your trip. Pros: Location! You cannot get more in the middle of everything. 10 minute walk to just about every site except the Pantheon which is literally meters away; even the usually out of the way Vatican was a pleasant 20 minute walk. Safe, lots of restaurants and smart shops around (including internet cafes, travel agents who book train tickets, etc). Luxury amenities in the room like fancy soaps, robes, etc. Fair sized room for a city hotel, especially the nicely sized bathroom with full tub (and we were in the smallest room they have). The girls at the check in desk are cute and helpful. They seem to know just about every language between them, so everyone feels at home. Cons: The room itself was just so so on the furnishing and upkeep. For example, there was terrible scratching where the luggage rack is, right in the main visible corner of the room (see pictures). Clearly multiple scratches over many occasions and the hotel just did not care about that level of detail to fix it. Gives the room a 1 star motel feel for sure. The furnishing and bedding were totally on par with Holiday Inn Express (which if you have gone to you know is actually a nice sub-chain of Holiday Inn, but not 5 star). There is no pool or similar area. The front of the hotel is in line with everything else in the area – nothing special at all, and the well lit internet pictures do not give an accurate representation. Don’t expect it to look any different from any other hotel. Lobby was nice but nowhere near 5 stars. Their photographer was again good with the lighting and angles. They want money for every little thing- there is nothing that is high (included) service. When we got there before the room was ready, they stored our one bag and scowled when we carried it to the room (tip free) ourselves. Other hotels of this caliber have put my bags in the room when it was ready and certainly don’t troll for tips. Internet/TV entertainment is a crazy E23 for the full package per day. Not that you are inside a lot when you are in beautiful Rome, but it would have been nice to have something to keep me occupied through that initial jet lag (and to check plane arrangements, etc). Basic breakfast is E35 per person. Again, there are sooo many great places to eat around there, no reason to eat in the hotel, but sometimes if you have an early tour it is nice to have the option of eating in the hotel without mortgaging your home. Overall not worth the price (even half price that I got on Priceline), and although I was not unhappy with my stay (simply neutral), I would not stay there again – too many other places to try in the same area. (Later in our honeymoon we stayed in Paris at a really expensive hotel as well, which was actually worth the splurge for a special occasion.)

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: horncall19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic!!! We booked a basic room here and got upgraded to a De Luxe room, which was amazing. The location of this hotel is also the best in Rome. It is 10 minutes to the best locations and being next to the Pantheon is amazing. There are fantastic restaurants and some really good gelato. They brought up champaign and chocolates for us, which were to die for! We had a great time at this hotel and recommend it to anyone looking for the prefect place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location at a Price”
Reviews.Author: JacOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel, next to Pantheon, is excellent, within walking distance of everything you want to see, Walked to Colosseum and taxied back. Husband was on business but I was on holiday. Had meal for one - steak sandwich with frites, glass of Prosecco, glass of red wine on roof top bar Euros 52. Breakfast available until 10.30 and adequate. Plenty of good value eateries in area, without the view! Room clean and well serviced, lovely towels and nice smellies but air con seemed to be centrally controlled not available during the night or early morning. Staff very helpful and professional, organised a guide for us to visit Vatican City and did on line check in for us for return home.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Archie's Mom
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The location was beyond my expectations for good. Steps from the Pantheon, very close to some great trattorias, in the square with a hidden gem of a little church with its own Michelangelo. Our room was very spacious, with a big entrance hall, great bath and beautiful appointments. The restaurant on the roof was great. We were told it closed at the end of October, but it was open during the first week of November and the views were magnificent. I have read reviews of old carpet and small rooms at this hotel, but we saw none of that. I consider myself a very picky hotel selector, and this was one of my best picks ever! I highly recommend for the overall ambiance and charm, the beautiful room and the location of your dreams for negotiating Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarin70
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is excellent being right near the Pantheon. You are walking distance to most everything which makes it easy to navigate Rome. The service is very good as all of the staff are incredibly willing to help make your stay enjoyable. Everybody from the concierge to the front desk and in particular Paul who works the front door were very helpful and professional. the downside was "the "2 bedroom suite" that we stayed in was very dated and in need of a renovation. I would have been ok with this if the price reflected the condition of the room but in no way did these accoodations warrant the cost. I would stay here again if the price point was more reflective of this hotel being a 3 or being generous a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRP07
Reviews.Content: We hopped around to 3 of Rome's 5 star hotels using Priceline and this was by far my favorite find. Location is great - as everyone else has mentioned in their review. The staff is very personable (especially the bartender). The view from the roof is exceptional. Without Priceline, I would assume this is a little over priced but for our purposes, it was lovely. Great selection of toiletries (Bulgari) in the bathroom too!

Reviews.Title: “Keep saying great location!”
Reviews.Author: sfbsk
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel, but this could be countered by the fact that it is a great location. For the price, our room was not good value. It was small, and there was no air conditioning which I imagine would make it unbearable in summer. We experienced a catalogue of basic service failures e.g. sat with drinks menu but not approached for our order, waiter forgot to bring milk at breakfast, doorman fails to open door for my wife. Trivia, but it starts to become irritating considering the 5 star positioning. Perhaps it was the time of year (April) but in general the hotel seemed to lack atmosphere. Before staying there again, we would look to see what else was nearby because it is without question a great location.

Reviews.Title: “nice location vs average service”
Reviews.Author: WakeGuru
Reviews.Content: The webpage of the hotel gives a slightly misleading image of the hotel, in real life one will find a pretty old school hotel with an excellent location. But that’s about it. The staff was not ready to handle the needs of our group two mornings I had breakfast without tea, since nobody was able to bring it to me. There was no juice and the amount and choice of food was not on the level one would except for a 5 star hotel. The superior room on the pictures will has superior double bed, instead we had two beds in the room. The ventilation was poor, we had to keep the window open in order to decrease the temperature in the room, but the cleaning lady continuously closed it, as soon as we left the room. Due to the high temperature in the room it had a bad smell stemming from the bathroom! Last but not least Internet was for an extra charge 1eur/h and there was no wi-fi in the rooms. To summarize the only great thing about this hotel was the location, but I am sure for almost 300 Eur/night one can take a taxi 4 times per day and find a better value for money at location outside the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever, and we travel frequently.”
Reviews.Author: JDY60
Reviews.Content: Tiny room, chipped furniture, no air-conditioning in March despite humid, hot room. Our room was directly underneath the rooftop bar and next to the staircase to the bar. Party until wee hours at rooftop bar, music blaring, people stomping and yelling. Repeated requests for the bar to quite down after midnight were rebuffed. When party finally ended after 2:30am, staff continued moving furniture at 3 am for reset. Repeated requests for quiet were ignored. Front desk and bar staff were rude and difficult. Repeated requests to speak with night manager were denied. Location near Pantheon is convenient, but this is a two-three star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lisadiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. Great location, right next to the Pantheon. Service was impeccable. Breakfast was very good. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel surroundings made the trip just that more memorable.”
Reviews.Author: MisterStateTrooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 2010 for one week. Fantastic location, totally central, walk to most of the major sites on all sides very quickly. My opinion is that it's the location and charming surroundings makes this a 5 star. The hotel is just behind the Pantheon (which you really should make certain you go back twice to see thoroughly), it is a fantastic site to have just outside your hotel door, even if just to sit in the piazza and decompress at night with a beer or wine and ponder your adventures, while admiring the almost 2000 year old temple! The hotel shares it's own little Piazza della Minerva with the Basilica di Santa Maria sopra Minerva. The piazza itself has a famous Gian Lorenzo Bernini elephant sculpture, The Pulcino della Minerva, and, get this... the sculpture is a base supporting one of only eleven Egyptian obelisks brought to Rome back in the day, this one was made around 2500 years ago. Did I mention, all this just outside your door! I was looking at some other central hotels, none of which would have had the charm of having these surroundings, it really made the trip just that more memorable. The hotel building itself very nice building, and nicely lit up a night, beautiful lobby, just like the pictures. Our room had a courtyard view with some distant landmarks visible along with the nearby rooftops, some rooms have a view of the piazza and partial Pantheon view, although like I said, it's all right outside your door anyway. The bathrooms were marble or granite, built in hair dryer, the room was cleaned daily, and the bed turned down with complimentary chocolates. The windows open fully for fresh air. The air conditioning worked. The room was quite. The bed was huge, there were a few nice armchairs, table, desk, night stand, luggage rack, large closet, fridge, and mini bar, and TV if you so desired to pay the extra fees. The room itself could use a good paint job. For the room rates my only wish would be at least some free Internet WI-FI in the rooms. Rooftop patio has a minimum charge so I decided to skip it, and just had a few panini sandwiches and beverages nearby and sat in front of the Pantheon like I said, there's no way any rooftop patio could be better. Forgetaboutit. I didn't have much daily interaction with the staff, they seemed helpful when I checked-in, helped with bags, showed my the room, answering a few questions, and I know they helped several times to resolve a bit of confusion on my travel agents part, even before I arrived. I would recommend Grand Hotel De La Minerve. Quick Tips: - Pre-arrange for a ride to the airport at the end of your trip. - Buy your Vatican tickets on-line before you go. - Buy your Borghese Gallery admission on-line before you go. - Buy tickets to the Roman Forum first thing in the morning which include Palantine Hill and the Colosseum which you enter when your ready later in the day. - Research what you really want to see in each of the museums before you go, there's tons of stuff. - Bring a backpack and load up with some beverages to keep hydrated, buy them at one of the grocery stores for better prices. - Stay for longer than a week. - Navigating street by street could get tedious, but if your like me you need to know exactly where you are at all times, look at getting an IPhone with a travel data plan, or use the IPhone App "Rome MTrip" to plan your routes. - Bring comfortable shoes and some first aid. - Check out [-] for some cool travel items. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “if location is everything then this hotel is for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHorizonChaser
Reviews.Content: I wanted to set up a romantic visit to Rome for our 10 year wedding anniversary and this hotel placed us in the heart of historic Rome...brilliant!!! if location is everything for you then this will be a fantastic hotel option, but if you are looking for the finer elements normally associated with a 5star hotel then this may fall short. the hotel has an air of sterile stuffiness and may dampen your experience. The rooftop bar provides a great vantage point of the city and is a brilliant location to share a glass of wine or two after a day of sightseeing. we got caught out with the international phone call flyer beside the phone that said calls would be charged at standard international call rates....nothing further from the truth...watch this one. The hotel also tries to hit 5star ratings in the wrong way when attracting so many tourist...no iron available...only an ironing service which verged on the extent of buying new opposed to get it ironed!! if you need a central location and can give on other items then go for it. We had a great time and have no regrets but this is a once only hotel for us...

Reviews.Title: “Glad we made the decision to stay here”
Reviews.Author: HauntedMansion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March of 2010, and don't regret that decision at all. The location was perfect - from the front of the hotel you can see the Pantheon. It was a nice central location to branch out from every day without worrying about having to take a taxi through the crazy Roman streets. Our room was a corner room which afforded great views in multiple directions. The room was large by European standards, and was comfortable. The bathroom was floor to ceiling marble and huge! The hotel staff was very courteous - no complaints. Our reservation came with 2 included breakfast buffets each morning. This breakfast buffet far exceeded our expectations, and we still talk about it to this day. This would be worth paying extra for if it wasn't included in the room rate. Every day they had fresh fruit as well as fruits in syrup, scrambled eggs, the most amazing bacon I've ever had, breads, cheeses, sliced meats, pastries, cereals, and several types of juices. It sounds typical, but was much better than typical. The hotel offers free internet, but is only wired only (no WiFi) which was a tad annoying. They have free computers off the lobby for use, but during our stay they were remodeling and those were unavailable. We used the third option of using the Internet on the TV which was for a fee, but presumably due to the construction and unavailability of the public computers we were not charged for this use. As mentioned above, they were doing remodeling throughout the hotel during our stay, which I'm certain is completed by now. The staff did a very good job of keeping the disruption to a minimum and keeping us informed daily of any potential work that might be going on during the day, and it turned out to be a complete non-issue for us. We would easily choose to stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay for two nights”
Reviews.Author: adamkeshner
Reviews.Content: Staff are not just willing, the interior had not been renovated for a long time, the hotel is nothing special that there would ever want return. From our room were stolen part of our clothing and the hotel did not want to be taking responsibility.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but they need a reality check”
Reviews.Author: Highroad35
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the location for sight seeing and a quick business meeting. The location was great, easy walk to many sights, shopping and restaurants. Our agent booked us for one person, honest mistake. The hotel jacked the price when they saw we were two, stike one. We requested a non-smoking room, were given a smokey, poorly lit room that could not possibly be worth the inflated price, stike two. In general, apart from the well appointed lobby/sitting room, the place was not very clean with soiled carpeting in the halls and stairways. The walls and light fixtures in our room needed a good scrub. Overall, the hotel was very worn looking despite the superficial attempt at luxury. WAY over priced, stike three. We moved to the Weston the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Beautiful Hotel. Very nice room. Pay up.”
Reviews.Author: tmh_longisland
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice place that a business associate recommended. It is in a wonderful location (you MUST see the Sopra Minvera Church just next door.) We went South to the Coliseum, west to the Vatican, North to the Galleria Borghese & walked it all, with no problem. I've read in previous reviews that the staff was snooty (..or was it snotty?) They weren't on their hands & feet but they weren't that bad. The reviews about the A/C is true..it looks like A/C, it sounds like A/C, but it's more HV than AC. I wasn't thrilled with the room view but I paid with AE points. And at about 6:30am, the barbells from the gym across the hall got a little annoying. I guess you just want to say you dont want to be near the gym. Best part: a very nice rooftop cocktail/restaurant area with a gorgeous sunset view of Western Rome. (Someone had a wedding up there one night...very nice.)

Reviews.Title: “The Cement is Softer than the Bed. AVOID THIS LIKE THE PLAGUE!”
Reviews.Author: jdmapes
Reviews.Content: The one and only positive of this hotel is the location. It is very convenient to walk to all the sights from there. The biggest negative I had was the bed. It felt like it was made of cement, neither my wife nor I could fall asleep on it. We asked to either be moved to a new room, as we could tell this mattress was circa 1970, but were informed that since we booked out hotel through hotwire and had a steep discount, that they would not give us another room. The staff was rude, not helpful at all. I don't know who decided this was a five star hotel, I've had better rooms and better service at a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Heatherlp
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here at the beginning of October and very much enjoyed our stay. We were given a very pleasant & clean room on the 6th floor facing the courtyard. I enjoyed being able to open the windows in the room and bathroom to get a nice breeze into the room. The hotel had a nightly turn down service with delicious chocolates as well as huge towels, slippers, and bathrobes in the bathrooms. The shower pressure was wonderful (better than at home) Even though the room was on the small side, there was enough room for 2 people since they had hangers and shelves in the closet as well as a very comfortable bed and a work desk for when we needed to use our computer. We did have to pay a fee for the internet, but didn't need to use it very often so the charge wasn't very much. The tv was a flat screen, but the channels in English were very limited (MSNBC & MTV), but we didn't go to Rome to watch TV. I found out ahead of time whether breakfast was included (it was) and was happy with the choices they had. The wait staff served beverages and were very pleasant. We had very early morning tours each morning so I was only able to enjoy the breakfast one day while I was there. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly, spoke fluent English, and, on our first night, suggested a great restaurant only a few blocks away. I would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect, being that the Pantheon was only steps from the hotel and Piazza Navona was about 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “I will never ever book this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Mariecaroline12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. When we got there we were told that there was no room for us despite having already paid 900 Euros for 2 nights. The staff told us that a group of people refused to leave their room so the best they could do was to put us in a different hotel in the other side of Rome that had "kind of the same rating and price". After having refused to change hotel we eventually got a hotel room which just proved that they had lied to us all along. The service is really poor and not at all what you would expect from a "5-star" hotel in this price range. In addition to this the staff were very rude and unhelpful with such things as assisting with reservations etc. Do not choose this hotel for your stay in Rome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: goldhair46
Reviews.Content: The Pantheon is right out the door! The Piazza Navona is a block away. The staff is extremely helpful in every way. Room was very clean. The only thing we missed was not having a coffeepot in the room. I also would avoid the very overpriced restruant on the roof. You won't regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “3 star at best”
Reviews.Author: Kerjner
Reviews.Content: Hello Trippies I booked this hotel through Priceline. I got what seemed like a good deal until one of the staff told me that because i got such a good rate normally included amenities now now become chargeable as add ons. Beware of this. If you book through online sites and get a good rate they will nickle and dime you when you get there. Parking - parking is off premise and is 40 euros per night . By the way you have to call one hour in advance to get your car. At 40 euros a night the car should arrive lickedy split. By the way I got my car back with foot prints on the hood and bumper so someone walked over my car. Not quite what you expect for 40 euro a night parking. Wifi - 5 euros an hour for wifi and its only available in the lobby. There was a daily max of 15 euros. 5 star hotels typically don't charge for bad wifi that has only lobby range. Room - because of my good rate thy gave me a subpar room with mold on the bathroom ceiling and a large access panel missing from the ceiling at the entrance. They were unwilling to give me a better room due to my priceline rate. The only good things about the hotel is the location and roof top restaurant overlooking Rome. The roof top restaurant is very pricey for nothing. Basically I found this hotel calls itself 5 star when it's really providing 3 star service and amenities. I hope this helps you in your hotel decision in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and grand.”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraW75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Rome from the advice of Effetto, a travel service. The location was perfect. We were able to walk to almost everything. It sits right next to the Pantheon which we could view outside of our room. It was also on a square, so you could listen to street musicians if you opened the windows. The suite was absolutely beautiful. Canopied bed, about 15 foot ceilings with inlayed wood. Both bathrooms were full baths with jacuzzi tubs. Service was excellent, and the staff very helpful with points of interest. They have a rooftop restaurant and bar which we enjoyed very much the first evening we checked in. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. We would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Great location good sleep great place to come back to on a hot day”
Reviews.Author: upperdeckplease
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August 2010. We had booked on the web and were put in a superior room, which was fine but too small. I asked to change and they put us in a much larger superior room (108) on the first floor. Location is superb, and in August this meant a lot, as we could come back to the hotel, have a shower and cool off. Bed was massive and very comfortable. Rooftop restuarant was romantic, but overpriced. Rooftop bar has great views. Prices in Rome are absolutely crazy. Very easy to spend 100 Euros for a meal for two. Breakfast buffet was wonderful; freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit, eggs and fifty things to choose from, which sets you up for a good morning's tourism before lunch. At the price we paid (low due to summer) would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ernierad
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the Pantheon. Walked to the coliseum, spanish steps, trevi fountain, best shopping district and great restaurants all arond. Try Armondos just 1 block away for incredible differences. Our room overlooked the Pantheon square. Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf / Professionalism / Courtesy / Acommodating”
Reviews.Author: rico_mad
Reviews.Content: It was an expensive hotel but you certainly get what you pay for. Breakfast was great. Eggs, pasteries, cereal, fruit, etc. And good service. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The Concierge, Luigi, was absolutely accomodating. Resteraunt suggestions were fantastic. The front door was always opened for us with a smile when we entered or exited the hotel. The location is as good as it gets. Steps away from the Pantheon and a taxi is always available right outside. We stayed with a our family of 5 including three pre-teen children. Unfortunately they cannot accommodate five in one room so we had no choice but to book two expensive rooms. This is the only negative...cost. But to vacation in Italy is to spend money like it is wine. You need to put yourself in that mode so you don't get aggrevated by being robbed all over town. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ChingoChinga
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel many times over the past 10 years for business, and recently twice in the past year on personal trips. The location is excellent -- just off the Piazza della Rotonda (pantheon) and walkable to all kinds of historic sites in the downtown area. The lobby and common areas are beautiful and the staff is welcoming and professional. The rooms are spotless and very comfortable. Not all rooms have nice views - have had rooms with views of city and also rooms with windows opening into the alley - but that's what you get in a downtown location. The only reason we didn't give it 5 for service on this trip is that our laundry didn't get processed as requested. Was probably an oversight because we have never had that experience in the past. HIghly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: spursone
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. Traveling were myself, wife and 14 year old daughter. We booked a Junior Suite at this hotel so that we could have some extra room. The room was very nice and to our surprise, came with a very large outside terrace. (app. 15x25 feet) The large bathroom had a shower/bath combination. The furniture was nice and inviting. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Our room did not include the breakfast buffet. We usually ordered a pot of coffee since Italy does not seem to have good places for to-go coffee. There is a nice grocery store about a block and a half from the hotel and we found this a good place to buy fruit and other things for breakfast. The best thing about this hotel is location. It is a one minute walk from the back of the Pantheon. There is also a rooftop bar and restaurant with incredible views of the city, including the top of the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “BELLISSIMO & PERFECT HIDEAWAY IN THE MIDDLE OF ROME RIGHT BEHIND THE PANTHEON”
Reviews.Author: mizzjoy
Reviews.Content: If you visit rome, this hotel will not disappoint! The location is perfect-right next to the cathedral minerva in a square right behind the pantheon in the middle of Rome. It is safe, quiet, elegant and spacious. The service is stellar! I left my jewels in the safe and the hotel fedexed them to me and all survived and arrived in perfect order within less than 24 hours. The breakfast buffet will leave you spellbound. This hotel gave me the best cappuccino I have ever had. This hotel offers gracious service. The Grand Hotel Minerve is truly a five star experience that should be shared with friends and loved ones. If you are on business, you will not be disappointed. When you come in from the bustling, noisy and urban center, here you enter an oasis of calm and elegance at the Grand Hotel Minerve. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - no doubt!”
Reviews.Author: ViraatRaj
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through www.clickitbookit.travel and got a fantastic rate compared to the other online booking sites. We stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve in Rome from the 9 to the 14th of July 2010 The location is fantastic- right next to the Pantheon and a 10 minute walk from the Spanish steps, Trevi, Via Condotti as well as the hop on hop off tour, Piazza Venezia, Colosseum and a host of other cathedrals, attractions and shopping joints. The hotel is an old palace turned into a hotel and hence has a lot of character. The entrance is small though and faces Miverve square right opposite a beautiful church- Santa Maria ( Saw so many cathedrals and churches, i think it was Santa Maria). The Vatican and St Peter's is a One Euro ride on bus 62 or 64 and takes about 8-10 minutes to get to. Service is decent at the hotel. The rooms are well appointed though the aircon could be much better. Breakfast is a decent spread but the hotel would do well to change the menu - even a little-instead of the same offering- daily. However, the staff at the breakfast hall as well as the reception are extremely polite and willing to help - in whatever fashion. They all spoke good English too. All in all, a great stay and i would certainly stay here again. Hope i get the same rates on www.clickitbookit.travel again for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for the nightly cost”
Reviews.Author: gcaudle
Reviews.Content: Two night in this hotel were enough. Minimal accommodation for the price. Our room backed onto a residential street that included open windows and as an added bonus - clucking chickens at six in the morning!!! I thought I was back on the farm. At first it was charming, but it wore a bit thin the next morning. The breakfast was very expensive for our taste (30 euro each plus mandatory gratuity). We thought we were much closer to St. Peter's than we were, but we can't fault the hotel for that. We asked the concierge (Luigi) to run several errands for us. He was gracious and handled everything efficiently. Being close to the Pantheon was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “great location....but that's it”
Reviews.Author: Dublady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights with my husband and cannot say enough about the location. It is a max of 15 mins from all the major sights and so is a great base for a first visit to Rome. The rest of the hotel however I would not grade as a 5 star - the breakfast was fine however the buffer seemed to run low on some items without replenishment and the rooms at the front are very noisy. The rooms are big however, the bath rooms could be cleaner. Also housekeeping entered our room twice eventhough we had a do not disturb sign up! Overall a nice stay, not a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton6
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat the positive comments (all deserved) about the location of this property. We did, however, find the service a little quirky, but we would stay there again nonetheless. When we arrived on an early flight from the states, our room was not ready and would not be ready until noon. We went out for a walk and came back around 9:30 to be told that we could have the same room one floor lower if we wished. We were very appreciative of the woman at reception having taken a personal interest in us. Very impressive. We had a good-sized room with a king sized bed, but no pillows. We found one in the closet and assumed that the others would arrive during the day. When the turn-down service people showed up, we managed to explain our dilemma (they did notice our pillow situation). We asked for 3 and they found 2 somewhere. Good for them for caring! When we called the desk later for the fourth, they called back and said that all rooms were booked that night and they had no more pillows, but would get us one the next day. It never arrived, but having 3 pillows instead of 4 is not a big deal. Later in our stay, we asked the person who was filling in for the concierge to make a dinner reservation for us at a specific restaurant. She couldn't get through, and said she'd do it and let us know. Hearing nothing, I went downstairs later to find the woman gone, the note on the counter, and no call having been made. Marco, the regular concierge, was extremely helpful in getting us dinner reservations and making excellent suggestions for restaurants. So we had a couple of quirky experiences, but generally the staff is friendly, helpful, and professional. The room was extremely quiet and clean, and the location is unbeatable. The room we booked came with free wi-fi, which we always appreciate. We will stay at this hotel on future visits to Rom.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of complete renovation”
Reviews.Author: McGyverNYC
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels, which arrogantly only counts on it's fine location. In this case next to the Pantheon. Everything else in this so called 5-star hotel is in fact three stars - it's not nearly up to the standards of a 350-Euro-plus hotel and should be closed, till the owners made a complete rennovation with not a local, but an international acclaimed architect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sightseeing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick P
Reviews.Content: The Minerve is wonderfully positioned to see all the wonderful sights of Rome. Our room was literally overlooking the quite remarkable Pantheon. Also on it's doorstep is the Santa Maria church which, like so many churches in Rome has a Michaelangelo sculpture and wonderful art. Nothing in the centre is more than a half hours stroll away (Vatican 20 mins, Spanish Steps 20 mins, Colosseum 15 mins, Piazza Novona 5 mins, The Pantheon 1min) The room we had, a superior, was a little small but comfortable and with everthing one would want, TV, good shower, great toiletries, comfy bed etc. The roof bar/restaurant is wonderful place to relax, food good and they mix a nice cocktail. Staff are couteous and helpful. If you want/have to do the Vatican ask them to book a private tour, 70euros per person but well worth it to avoid the queues (we had a delightful American girl, Cady , who was great and very knowledgable. My top tip is get up early to avoid the crowds, at 8.30am we were the only people in the Pantheon, by midday it was hard to get in! My only gripes about the hotel is the lack of plunge/swimming pool on the quite enourmous roof space, For the loss of probably only one room it would be a fantastic addition to the hotel and a blessed relief on a hot afternoon. Also the air conditioning is a little noisy, but at least the windows open, a rarity nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “GH Minerve: Heart of Rome, Quality Service, Mostly Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: QueensLanderTours
Reviews.Content: My hats off to the Grand Hotel de la Minerve as they provided our recent small group tours from QueensLander Tours an excellent stay. As with the majority of Italian hotels we have found it imperative that our tour directors inspect rooms prior to guest's occupying them - many of the properties in the historical centers of Rome (and the other great cities) are truly worthy of historic note themselves and that simply means they've been there for a long time. That's no excuse to allow a property to fall apart and the team at the Minerve are working diligently to keep their hotel up to a 5 star experience. My criticisms of the Minerve are limited to some stains on carpets in hallways and very few 'scuffs' on the walls from what appears to be luggage damage. Other than that the service, quality of the rooms and amenities are definitely Italian 5 Star. The rooftop terrace is seasonal and that's why we visit Rome during the best season from April to October with our great cities tour. Their breakfasts are great, too. Location is the overall winner for sure - in the heart of Rome but on a 'quiet' street and piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Minerve in early May. Our room was beautiful and had a great view of the plaza and the Pantheon. Our breakfasts each AM were amazing and all the staff were most accomodating. We will definitely return to this historic and lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel for a leap into the past”
Reviews.Author: Nicks26
Reviews.Content: I was there with my girlfriend at the beginning of May. Ever since the cab stopped at the hotel entrance in Pazza delle Minerva, behind the pantheon, we were totally amazed!!!! It seemed like going back in time! The location is definitely the best in the city, we went around every day, and in walking distance it is possible to reach the best places of the City, like The Spanish Steps, The Trevi Fountain, Piaza Navona, The Colosseum and much more! The hotel is also very close to Via Condotti, which means that you can totally loose your girlfriend for hours in the best shopping street ever! The room was absolutely beautiful with a breathtaking view of the square... i felt like I could have touched the pantheon. My girlfriend and I have travelled a lot and we both agree that luxury make sense only if it offers you something from the past, and this hotel is like a sort of a museum in the heart of the Eternal City! EVERYTHING WAS SO PERFECT THAT WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK...!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but don't have anything ironed!”
Reviews.Author: MonsoonalBlue
Reviews.Content: Requested an iron and ironing board for items that had creased during travel. The hotel does not provide an iron and ironing board in the rooms, so we had no option but to have the hotel iron them for us. We paid 88 Euro for 5 items - three of them being very small childrens items. Unbelieveable - how do you not feel embarrased to rip off your guests in such a blatant manner?

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: lab27
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location in the historic centre of Rome, extremely kind, attentive staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: speechcb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible! Service was awful! Rooms were dated, dirty, and not maintained. There were stains on the carpeting and scuff marks on the walls. The hairdryer was terrible! The hallways were dirty. The hotel roof top bar/restaurant was not opened, the air conditioning was not working, and we were never told that they hotel was undergoing some cosmetic work; painting. The all artwork was removed from the hallway leaving the hook and dirty ring where there was once a picture. The room size was small and the bathroom was very small. Very over rated hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - great views”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerMA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I and another couple stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October 2008. On the same trip we had also rented a house in Tuscany for a week and then spent a few days in Amalfi. We decided to head back to Rome a day earlier and the hotel was very accomoding to giving us an additional night at the same rate. The location couldn't have been better - we walked from our hotel to everything and did not need to take cabs at all except to/from the airport and we actually partially took the train from the airport because of the time of day. (Many of thye hotels in Rome are far outside of the core of the city and you will waste time and money travel to and from them.) I know a lot of people have complained about the price - but hello! This is Rome we're talking about. We paid about $280 per night and we thought it was quite reasonable. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. Our room was a good size ( again for a city hotel in Europe) and actually had a separate seating room and two tv's. The bathroom was well appointed and had nice ammenities including a day/night face cream combo which for anyone who travels regularly on planes you can appreciate. The best part of this hotel was the rooftop bar. We met there daily after our travels around the city and met many of the same people there each night and had regular "happy hour" crowd of sorts. The views from this rooftop deck were spectacular and if for no other reason this is a great reason to stay here. I would definitely stay again if I were traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Paying too high for the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MBLUX
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the center and a perfect location to walk around any part of the historic or more modern parts of Rome. There is almost no better location, no need for taxi, bus everything is within 20 minutes walk through this beautiful city. But for the price that you have to pay you get not a lot of value. The breakfast is nice and the special "tasting" dinner is perfect; and the lobby is very nice and unfortunately was the terrace on top of the hotel not open as that might have been nice. BUT the rooms are outdated in every way. The suite has an ultra tiny bathroom and smallish bad room with very hard beds. And the living room as so big that the only 1 desk, 2 small chairs and sofa look ridiculous in it. A waste of space and my money it does NOT invite you to go sit there have a coffee and watch a TV which is at a 6 meter distance. Overall a disappointment, luckily the city itself made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: philget
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome so we searched Hotwire for a hotel close to tourist attractions, assuming the tradeoff would be noise and crowds. To our surprise, our windows opened onto the quiet and picturesque Piazza Della Minerva. The most notable sound was that of a very romantic violin in the evening. The teenagers got a large room with a balcony, facing a peaceful inner courtyard. We upgraded to a suite so as to not be outdone, giving us a very spacious living area. The spectacular lobby, common rooms and decor contributed to an oasis-like ambience which made it easier to brave this busy city and the crowds at the coloseum, forum, etc. all of which are within walking distance. Breakfast was fine - you're just not going to get homefries and pancakes in an Italian hotel - but we did get cereal, granola, scrambled eggs, fruit, smoked salmon, etc. We got some snacks at the bar one night but didn't eat dinner in the hotel due to the price. We did try several nearby restaurants, of which our favorite was the trattoria-like Ristorante Der Pallaro where, to quote their non-menu, "what we serve is what you eat".
