The concierge staff went out of their way for us on several occasions, most notably when I asked them to get tickets to the sold-out La Taviata at the opera house. They actually came up with two which I foolishly turned down, hoping for a better night. They later sent a staff member to the opera house to search for more tickets. They weren't successful but their effort impressed me. On the downside, TV movies were unavailable some nights and their one slow computer for guests made me glad we brought our laptop. They recognized the problem and let guests use the office computer and printer when asked. I suspect, but am not sure, that cabs are more expensive when they leave from the hotel than from other locations. To sum up, I have no serious criticisms of this hotel and would stay here again gladly (especially for the Hotwire price).

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Money”
Reviews.Author: mimi048Houston_Texas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in Rome celebrating his 65th birthday. We stayed in the Presidental Suite at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve. The location could not have been better, it is situated directly behing the Pantheon. Our room consisted of a very large living room with a full bath and a very large bedroom with another full bath. We put our extra Euro's and American cash in the room safe. The very first night we returned from an early supper and the safe was open and 400 Euros were missing. I shut the safe before leaving because I went back in it to get my watch. We reported it to the front desk but they revieved the log and said no one had entered our room while we were gone. Two days later we returned and our American cash was gone, the safe was closed. Again we reported it but they did nothing. After that we counted our money with a witness at the front desk and had them lock it in their safe. A hard lesson to learn, but as much as the room cost us, and the reputation of the hotel we never thought anything like that could happen. They said they did not have access to the safes in the rooms, but what do they do when someone forgets their code? We had to assume it was an inside job but we couldn't prove it. Just thought this is something travelers should consider when they put their money in a room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly gorgeous, a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: elainesl
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a stay in a 2-bedroom suite. The hotel is in a perfectly-convenient neighborhood, steps from the Pantheon, a 5-7 minute walk to Piazza Navona, a 10-minute walk to Campo dei Fiori. The hotel is venerable and grand, as befits its name. Our suite was roomy and beautifully-appointed, though our rooms had very dim light. Bedside reading was a strain; reading in our suite's lounge was nigh impossible. If we'd wanted to do any real work on computers and such, that would have been even more of a problem. The breakfast buffet was very pricey (31 euro pp, I believe) and while the food quality was very good, I can't say the range of offerings was worth the price, though the convenience counted a lot. When leaving Rome, we had to leave the hotel at 6am to make our early morning flight back to the USA. Incredibly, hot beverages (coffee, tea) are not available at that hour. The 'wee hours' menu included tomato soup, one or two sorts of sandwiches, maybe a plate of cookies, and that's it (4-5 items in all). No coffee. I still find it hard to believe. We were pleasure travelers, and there are business guests as well, who find it reasonable to be able to order coffee early in the morning, especially with this hotel's prices and reputation. Those criticisms aside, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: PeeBeeWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Had a room with a view over the Minerve Square. Always something to see/hear. Comfortable room. Great buffet breakfast. There was a problem with our booking on arrival, which was dealt with immediately. The roof-top terrace is beautiful, with an excellent singer/pianist. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with hotel employees.....”
Reviews.Author: ctsdoc1
Reviews.Content: While true, it is a 5 star hotel in a great location in Rome.....we were disappointed with all the staff at the hotel. NEVER a smile or eye contact upon checking in. Upon leaving we never were asked how our stay was. The conciege was sufficient but less than friendly. Our room was clean but tiny. 2 drinks on their rooftop restaurant/lounge was approx $50 after dollar conversion. And when we went to the rooftop lounge to have a drink, while there were almost no people there, we went to sit on some couches and were told that to sit on the couch would be an extra 10 Euro per person! We moved to the tables....Overall other than the location, we were not that impressed.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR hotel, location, staff...can't say enough good about it!”
Reviews.Author: t2009adventure
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Super location right by the Pantheon. Our window looked out on the Pantheon. Room was spotless, huge, well furnished and offered sumptuous amenities -- lovely roof garden, cool and inviting lobby -- very helpful, attentive staff. I would recommend it enthusiastically. It is located in the heart of Rome many plazas offer great restaurants, people watching and easy of travel. Meals in this area are a bit pricey, but no worse than NYC or Paris. You will not be disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FabulousMom
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was initially a bit apprehensive when I booked this hotel because of the less-than-savory reviews I have read on Trip Advisor. Good thing, I was convinced by our travel agent to give this hotel a try and I can say that I don't regret staying here. First of all, this hotel is but a stone's throw away from the famous Pantheon, walking distance from Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (although this one I consider a longer than usual walk). The receptionists and concierge were very helpful and were willing to answer "touristic" questions no matter how trivial they may be. The room and toilet were quite large and very clean. Internet was not free so that was a bummer. They changed foreign currencies at very reasonable rates. Breakfast was quite good and the selection of breads, pastries, fruits and juices was quite extensive (by European standards). If you need to go to the Vatican, a cab can take you there for less than 10 Euros so it's not that bad. Souvenir shops are practically everywhere, you just have to walk a little bit along the side streets. Saturday nights can be a bit noisy nearby because of teenagers going to clubs but the noise level won't reach your rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Near Pantheon & Piazza Novana - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: DawnTodd
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Europe for our 20th anniversary was unbelievable! The experience included a wonderful stay in this beautiful Grand Hotel de la Minerve. I searched for weeks looking at websites for many hotels and found this gem. It was elegant and clean, well appointed and very quiet, our room was superb. The staff was also always accomodating, friendly and helpful whether we were coming or going. They sometimes mistook us for imposters when we arrived in back in our shorts and T-shirts from a long day of sightseeing, but a smile and reminder that we were guests, would give us clearance :) The architecture and decor was impressive and location was undeniably the best. All the cafe's at Piazza Novana and the Pantheon were a few steps away! Thank you to everyone who made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great... but (ok)...”
Reviews.Author: elyfretz
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the service at the Minerva, while parts where great such as the roof top garden restaurant and bar, others where completely lacking. When we checked in the night manager was completely unaccommodating and seemed bothered to have to talk to us. The breakfast was good, but overpriced (30 Euro / pp) and the fact that they charge for internet access is quite frankly childish for a so called 5 star property. This isn't Starbucks! We actually experience the same staff member barging into our hotel room only to apologize and close the door, apparently knocking first is a novelty. Luckily everyone was dress! The other major annoyance was the Bell hop operating as the concierge. He had limited knowledge of the city and was generally unhelpful. The full time concierge seemed to return a day later who was much more on top of his game, he was insightful and able to point out a few hidden gems. So hopefully this was just a temporary staffing relapse. Besides these details which seem to make or break an excellent experience, the Hotel rooms were nice and the bathrooms have shower curtains! Hooray, yes this seems like a no brainier to any American, but for some reason Europe opts for the glass retainer that retains no water at all. Let's get to work on that! Seriously, the bathrooms were nice! Stone finish, luxury fixtures, good lighting, etc. The typical rooms decor was nice and the layout made sense. Agreed again the bedding is not 5 star and the pillows are not lush. Complements on the safe it is enormous! You could put your whole laptop inside! Honestly if I was AAA rating this hotel in America it would lose a star, it's not a 5 star property. But then again this is Europe and the whole rating system seems a bit inaccurate. I have seen 5 stars that are 4 and 4's that are 5, 3's that are 4 and vise versa. Decent place for the money, (250 Euro/ night) but don't call this a 5 star hotel. It's no St. Regis or Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vburmester
Reviews.Content: My partner and stayed here a few weeks ago and were terribly disappointed. Our room was not ready upon arrival, despite requesting early (12 PM) check-in. If the reception staff had been friendly and apologetic, then we'd have shrugged our shoulders and felt alright about it. Instead, the receptionist was frosty and gave us the impression that we were not welcome. This attitude was to become a theme. Our room was like a Travel Inn - cleanish (last person's pubic hair in bath) but functional. It was certainly not 5* by my previous 5* experiences. The loo leaked (it was fixed) and there was damp and peeling paper near the bathroom. My laundry was lost by housekeeping and the hotel did not feel any responsibility for this. A hotel employee mysteriously barged into the room, without so much as a knock at the door, and my boyfriend was naked in the hall at the time. We did get a complimentary bottle as an apology for this event. It's not that this is the worst hotel you could book into, just terribly overpriced, below 5* and unwelcoming. Try the Regents Grand instead. p.s. the pillows are like rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Felt robbed and hugely dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i did not stay in the hotel itself so we cannot comment on these facilities. We visited the hotel's rooftop restaurant - it has a spectatular location with beautiful views. The positives end there. The food choices are poor (we should have left after seeing the menu), the service average, the food - awful and overpriced. After spending near 30 euro on pasta with seafood my boyfriend had expected more than one prawn and two scranwy langoustine! My turbot was overcooked and the rice inedible. For a supposedly 5 star offering i was terribly disappointed and 80 euro down. In fairness on complianing we were offered another meal - to be honest, the fist one was so bad i just wanted to leave. Go for a drink in the bar - enjoy the view and then leave!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: reiddg
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Minerva. Our flght arrived early and we were to the hotel by 10 AM. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our rooms were ready. Our room was a junior suite and had a lovely terazza. The rooms were very clean and well maintained. The hotel itself was spotless. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Be sure to stop into the bar when there, either on the rooftop or in the lobby. The bartenders are a hoot and the ambiance is excellent. We have not eaten in the restaurant so we can't speak to their food. However, the snacks put out by the bartenders was unbelievable. Nuts, canapes, etc. Very enjoyable. We like to try different hotels whenever we're in Roma, but since finding the Minerva, we will look no further. It's central location makes easy walking distance to many of the sites. I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants an enjoyable stay. It's a bit pricey but worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location Eclipsed by Price and Not-so-good Service”
Reviews.Author: aseidman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in what is perhaps one of the best locaitons in Rome. I have been to Rome about 8 times, and each time I stay in a different hotel for the new experience. Grand Hotel De La Minerva was the most expensive hotel I stayed in and I can tell you that my colleagues agree with me whan I say its just not worth the money ! The lobby is beautiful, the rooftop restaurant is very nice, rooms are fine (although small like much of Rome's hotels), but the place is just way to stuffy, expensive and pretentious and the prices for a coffee or the most basic items are rediculous. What was really disapponting was the attitude of much of the staff. It was almost like "hey, be happy we let you stay here... this is an expensive hotel !". Well at nearly 500 dollars a night... I think they need to be happy people stay there.. not the guests. All said, it was far from horrible.. and please see my other reviews just so you know I am not a critical traveler. This place just under-delivered and over-charged for everytyhing ! For my money, there are better places to stay in Rome.. unless of course you get a really good rate here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad service”
Reviews.Author: cmattar1602
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel de la Minerve was recommended to me by a close personal acquantance who had frequently used the hotel many years ago. After he had raved about it so much, we decided to proceed and book 3 nights there. Unfortunately from check-in to check-out the service was horrendous! After pulling up to the hotel, there was no bellman to handle our luggage. Check-in was all but welcoming. After reaching the room, we were on the second floor in a corner room with a window which barely let in any sunlight. The room was standard. It felt more like a business hotel than anything, but generally clean. We asked the concierge for recommendations of restaurants in the area and he seemed almost baffled and ill prepared to respond to our questions. Another incident with the night concierge where we asked for help, he had advised he would get back to us with a reply. After a couple of hours, we went downstairs and asked for an update and he said there was no luck. There seemed to be no real desire to service the guest. Check out service was equally horrendous. My husband brought the bags downstairs to the lobby, pulled the car up to the hotel and put the luggage inside with no assistance from anyone in the hotel. 5 star luxury I DONT THINK SO!!!!!!! Terrible service--- YOU CAN DO BETTER IN ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Warning about the Sixth Floor and bell staff”
Reviews.Author: jls1
Reviews.Content: An expedia booked room resulted in a room on the sixth floor for our Saturday arrival. This floor is no penthouse because with the roof terrace above we were kept awake until 130am by the dragging of tables and the wait staff running through the corridor with the dirty plates and washing in the small hours. A Fawlty Towers moment if there ever was one. We complained at the time, twice, and were promised it would stop. It didn't. We were moved to another room the next day without much apology or explanation, they clearly knew this is major problem, frankly though this floor should not be in use, or they need to think very carefully about the roof. Oh and the hotel arranged a taxi to the airport who refused to honour the mandated 40 eur trip fee, something we confirmed with the concierge. Hotel location is excellent and is an interesting building but given the lack of consideration they give to paying guests, you'd have to be very specific that you will not accept a room on the sixth floor.

Reviews.Title: “WoW! Stunning location if you can afford the price”
Reviews.Author: Mickydot
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Minerve used to be a Royal Palace and has a enviable position in the heart of this historic city, 30 seconds walk from the Pantheon, 2 minutes from the Spanish Steps and 5 from the Piazza Navonna. This really is the centre of the tourusts Rome, and the price charged by this hotel reflects this. The card on the back of my bedroom door informed me that my room cost 600euros per night, with breakfast 31 euros per person extra, bearing in mind that my room was smaller than my Son's bedroom at home, this is high end pricing. The decor and finishings of the hotel are of the highest standard, but you get the feeling that they have tried to get as many rooms as possible into this stylish ex-palace, rather than creating something you will return to again and again. You must go up to the rooftop terrace/bar/restaurant an hour or so before sundown and get terrific views of the city, but don't expect the same view from your room, most look out onto a wall a few metres away. Saying all this, if you can get this hotel at a good rate on line, and don't expect a palacial room, then the location has it.

Reviews.Title: “THE GRAND HOTEL DE LA MINERVE EXCEEDED OVER EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: romansunshine
Reviews.Content: It is probably one of the most well known Hotels in Rome. I have decided to book there for my Roman latest stay. I must say that reviews on this Hotel do not help. Nevertheless, I ended up booking there since I got a special deal. Then I thought I could compare history, other opinions and what is my perception and taste. Well, the Hotel Grand de la Minerve won my bet. The only way to get there is by cab, however you are in Rome, you are in the real touchable ancient centre of Rome. How breathtaking it is, no words over the feelings while staring around you. The Hotel, just partially refurbished, is magnificent in its early century building, famous Murano glasses all around the lobby, large spaces; traditional in its style as it should be due to the location. Last but not least, professional staff. It is definitely a full 5 star service Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: anticorpo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property in a very fascinating spot in Rome. Our room was decently large and very quiet. Some parts of the rooms are renovated, other not so much. Overall, very good standard. Bed slighty too stiff. What we liked most was the quiet elegance ad the atmosphere in general. Responsive staff. A bit too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but ....”
Reviews.Author: BianchiNetherlands
Reviews.Content: For me it's the same as the other reviewers: the location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. The staff at reception, the concierge and the doorman are very friendly. The lobby and breakfast area look nice. I didn't particularly like the breakfast: dry bread and too many sweet pastries. Paying EUR 25-31 for breakfast is outrageous. My room was huge, so was the bathroom. The shower was great. Lots of space for my stuff. But... the ceiling in the bathroom could do with a renovation and not only the ceiling in the bathroom, but also in the hallways. The wallpaper is torn and the carpet is dirty. The cleaning ladies were chatting away at 8:15 on Sunday morning, which is far too early. If your room is next to the elevators, ask another room because you won't sleep. The elevators are old = very noisy. I didn't pay for the room myself because I was here for business, I would have chosen a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: emmessduesseldorf
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a long weekend in January '09. First things first: the location is simply unbeatable! From our room we saw the pantheon; the busy via del corso and corso Vittorio Emmanuele were in walking distance and you could manage campo di fiori and the spanish steps by foot! The staff was very efficient, helpful (concierge gave excellent advise on restaurants) and too well meaning: the room was overheated. Unfortunately. the water pressure in the bathroom was quiet low (okay, so it was on the fifth floor) and there was no room in the bathroom to put your toiletries on. On the other hand, the beds were broad and the breakfast buffet had a lavish range.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Asia2005
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our long weekend in Rome and I have to recommend this hotel. The location is the best and the staff is very proffesional and kind. They sorted out all our questions and little problems we have with Iberia´s strike.The concierge(Marco) was always happy to help us and very proactive. The restaurant (La cesta) has a great chef and the breakfast is perfect!Very good quality products and lovely atmosphere. I recommend the romantic package. Merry Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location. 1 minutes to the Pantheon, 2 minutes to the Piazza Navonna etc. The hallway is just beautiful and best feature is the roof terrace. It is just amazing if you sit up there, overlook Rome, listen to the church bells and enjoy the scenario. Absolutely fantastic, but that's it. The rest is just the usual rip off in Rome. I do not want to be too negative.... the rooms are big and definitely need a thorough make over/renovation. Oh yes, I had a renovation but outside the hotel with some nice construction workers doing their job in front of my window. And again, I do not think that you should pay extra for WLAN....not in this category. Would I recommend this hotel? Yup, for business travellers and please have a drink of the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tker48
Reviews.Content: I found it to be above average. It is just a 30 sec walk to the Pantheon. You can easily walk every where from the hotel. The train station is about a ten minute cab ride. The room was not that big, but it had a nice view and was very clean. Half of the staff was really nice. They also have a good view from the top floor. Next time I go to Rome I will probably stay here again-just because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen000
Reviews.Content: If you are only interested in a good location, Grand Hotel de la Minerve is fine because it does have a terrific location just steps from the Pantheon. But if you want a good night's sleep, helpful and nice staff, good service, etc., this is not the place for you. Most rooms open onto the piazza which provides interesting views, but terrible noise. After our 1st night of basically no sleep from the noise, we asked to be moved to a higher floor to provide a buffer from the cars and scooter noise. The staff did not try to hide their impatience with this request, even rolling their eyes right in front of us, arguing with us and more than once telling us our request was impossible. When the staff see you in the hotel, rarely do they offer any greeting or smile, even after making eye contact. We knew others in the hotel who also experienced this bad behavior, dubbing them rude. Good luck asking for a non-smoking room. They have them, but right next door will likely be a smoking room that filters into your room. They desperately need non-smoking floors to help with that. And they also don't monitor those rooms so the guest before you could have been smoking in your room and they admitted to opening the windows and spraying fragrancers into the air when that happens. The sheets for the bed are so coarse that you have to stay in one position all night, otherwise risking a spa exfoliation that you weren't counting on. The beds sit very low to the floor (easier to see the stains on the floor) and the decor is too modern for the surrounding atmosphere. All of that for a high rate that is no where worth price! There are plenty of other hotels in that area -- research those!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, too bad about the scaffolding.”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGIraffe
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our eight year old son stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve for three nights this past July. It is a gorgeous hotel, and also very conveniently located. The service we received was very good. The concierges, in particular, were very helpful. We loved the rooftop terrace. We had drinks there every night before going out to dinner, and it was definitely one of the highlights of our stay. The location was great. Our eight year old son was very upset that breakfast was not included with our room. We tried it one morning, but I frankly felt that it was too expensive for what it was, given that there were plenty of cafes in the Piazza della Rotunda that offered perfectly fine deals on breakfast. He was not pleased. Another problem was that there was scaffolding on one side of the building. They did upgrade us, from the deluxe double room we had booked with expedia, to a junior suite with one window overlooking the Piazza della Minerva. However, my son's pull-out room was still totally dark because of the scaffolding on that side of the building. He did not want to have to stay there again on our last night in Italy, after our visit to Capri. So I cancelled our reservation, and instead booked us into a junior suite at the Duke Hotel for that one night. Expedia was offering a terrific rate. Location was no longer an issue, as we were flying out the next morning. (We had a lovely experience at the Duke Hotel. The room was light and very comfortable, and the buffet breakfast was one of the best we had on our entire trip to Italy. We felt very well taken care of there. My son loved it.) We plan to return to Rome next summer. If the scaffolding is down, which one assumes it will be by then, we will maybe again stay at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve. My husband loved it there. He is an architect and was extremely impressed by the physical beauty of this historic building, which has been a hotel since the 19th Century. He was particularly awed by the ceiling heights in our two small rooms. (I may also check out rates on the Albergo del Senato, however, in order to satisfy my son's request for an included breakfast. He loves buffets. My husband does not wish to return to the Duke Hotel because of the location.) Anyone planning to stay at the Grand Hotel della Minerve this summer should call and find out about that scaffolding. If it is still up, make sure you have been assigned to a room that looks out onto the Piazza della Minerva, and not onto the side street.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: PERRY8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The location is really fantastic. Our room was lovely, spacious and clean. It had lovely views.The restaurant on the roof is wonderful, great setting and great food. Unfortunately we found that the hotel staff, apart from the concierge, were really unfriendly. Not up to the level of service you expect in a hotel classed as luxury. They all seemed that hey could not care less about their clients. The doorman in 4 days has not said a word to us, not once has he said hello or enquired about our day. He was completely ignoring anyone walking in or out of the hotel. The front desk staff is not any friendlier, they hardly say hello or smile. When we checked out no one asked wether we had a good stay and if we were happy with the hotel. A few smiles and a little small talk would have made all the difference. This was certainly not up to 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and room - food and drink expensive”
Reviews.Author: GOLFERS8
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday specila treat - the location could not be bettered - the superior room with fantastic view was all you could ask for. However, we paid the equivalent of £17 for two small beers on the roof top restaurant (with a bowl of peanuts). The breakfast was adequate, but the restaurant evening meal prices were out of the queston - we ate in local tavernas and bars. Jon Shepherd - West Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nonameprovided
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Hotel de la Minerve for 3 nights, the hotel was excellent, the rooms were lovely and very quiet at night. Staff very friendly and helpful and the concierge was fantastic in helping us to book into local restaurants. All of the main sightseeing sites are minutes away - the Pantheon is literally on the doorstep of the hotel. We walked everywhere and only got taxis to and from the airport. While the food was excellent, the only downside we experienced was the cost of lunch in the hotel's roof garden. We ate there just after we checked in (on recommendation from the reception desk) and found it extremely expensive in comparison to everywhere else we ate in Rome after that. There are so many great restaurants nearby, I would recommend eating outside of the hotel! Other than that, as other reviewers have said, I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. It is an excellent hotel and you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Hotel- Read This”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself a five star hotel. It simply is NOT. In a fantastic location near everything, this is a hotel with an atitiude...and not a very good one at that. It seems that they do you a favor giving you a room! The rooms are very small, and we stayed in a Jr. Suite!! The bathrooms are clean and adequate. Food in the hotel is a total ripoff...even if you pay in Euros. I mean 15 Euro for a cocktail? Or 22 Euro for an appetizer portion of pasta...or my favorite from the room service menu, a club sandwich at 27 Euro and Ice cream for 20, bringing the total to 47 Euro or (at $1.60 to the dollar), about $70!! And don't forget if you eat breakfast in the hotel is E25 ($40.00) Amazing. The view from the roof is incredible and like I said before, the location is just fantastic. We would recommend having a coffee at St Estacio (two blocks away), which serves the best coffee in Rome. And it's only 3 Euro. IF you need to stay in a real five star hotel, look elsewhere!! If you don't mind small rooms and a bit of an atitude, do stay here...Very disappointing!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel100
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Grand De La Minerva is in the heart of Rome. Rome is a lot like NYC you want to pay more for being in the middle of it all. This hotel is steps from the Pantheon ( which is the best place to hang out at night) minutes from The Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona and 10 minutes walking to the Coloseum, Forum, Capitol, Theater Marcello etc. Taxi's are hard to find, and you want to be anle to stroll around the city without wondering how you are going to get back to your hotel. This Hotel is not only centrally located, but the lobby is beautiful their breakfast is the best I've had in Italy by far and there staff is polite and very accommodating. I have stayed in hotels in the city center and on the outskirts. This by far is the best! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LillyWashington
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel with a fabulous location. Our room was 1 category above the standard room but it was extremely spacious, and well appointed. We had a room facing the courtyard overlooking the Pantheon only steps away. The windows actually open and you can soak up the night life if you like but it was not noisey. The bathroom was luxurious and had every conceiveable amenity. The hotel sent a welcome bottle of wine and biscotti as a nice touch. The service was refined and attentive. It was a truly memorable experience, one of the finest hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: turntime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve 4 nights in Rome and had a magnificent time. Although the hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff superb, the absolute best thing about this hotel is location, location, location!. Our window literally looked out onto the Pantheon, there were little pizza and gelato shops steps away, and we were a very short walk from the Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. The room was spacious and nicely equipped and the restaurant served delicious food. We highly recommend this hotel, even if just for the location alone. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Minerve- Wandering Brit”
Reviews.Author: First_Wandering_Brit
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Both times I had really large comfortable rooms. So the rooms are great. The bar is good and the food is ok (probably not 5 star but certainly 4-ish). The service is really good without being stuffy or too international. But what makes this hotel such a good place to stay is its location. All the major tourist sights are within walking distance; you are really in a great central location (you can see the Parthenon from front windows which I think is fun) and yet the hotel is peaceful and you aren't woken at stupidly early hours by any City bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: charles18050
Reviews.Content: All, This hotel is, overall, great value and a fabulous location. Its only a couple of steps to the Pantheon and the wondeful Piazza Navona etc. You really couldn't wish for a more central spot. The roof terrace (excellent view) and food is fabulous. Its pricey-ish, but not shocking for the clientele who'll stay here. Quality is very good. The room was clean, large and functional. The bath was the longest I've ever seen !! Minor moans are the lack of variety of the tv channels and the rather "sniffy" front desk staff. But hey, these are small distractions to an otherwise enjoyable experience. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and over rated”
Reviews.Author: robbieruadh
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at La Minerve in late October 2007. Having decided on a last minute trip a week before, we had little choice in hotel and paid the full rate of £320 per night for a superior room, bed & breakfast - a pretty hefty rate for any hotel in Britain. The room was a good size for city centre but not anything to write home about. The first night all the lights fused around midnight and we had to wait until 4 am before we were able to get the night porter to fix things. The young lady at the front desk seemed put out when we complained the next day - even more so when we commented that the night porter said that this frequently happened in that room. We asked for a change and were offered even smaller rooms. Eventually we moved to another equivalent room. In the evening we received an unexpected bottle of wine from the management as an apology. Internet access is charged at £5.00 per half hour!!! All in all, this kind of service and provision for this rate is basically a bit of a rip off. Great location if you feel like burning money!!

Reviews.Title: “Let's be honest”
Reviews.Author: SergeAx
Reviews.Content: Let's just be honest with ourselves: this is the only hotel of this class in that location, period. More to say: it's very hard to find а 5-star hotel in Rome with this price tag. So everyone who tries to compare it with 5-stars in South Asia or US are just unaware of the overall Rome hotels landscape. You may complain about breakfasts - or you can just have your own breakfast out on a nearest Piazza della Rotonda under the morning sun. You may dislike worn carpets or "simple" bathrooms or elevators - or think about an almost 3 centuries history of this place. You may play trouble with taxi - or just be awared of Rome traffic and holidays' roads closures. But you have to understand that you either live that near to every sigle attraction with that level of comfort at that price, or give up. Go on, try some 2-star places around and then come back and write a review :) By the way, the staff was very helpful, and the roof restaurant is just great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WBBatlanta
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 3 nights at the Minerve, and found it to be a wonderful hotel. Our room, though not huge, was very nice and had a fairly large courtyard overlooking the glass roof of the lobby. We had a package that included dinner at the rooftop restaurant, which was very good and the views can't be beat. The location of the hotel is absolutely ideal -- we walked everywhere, from the Pantheon next door to the Colleseum and Forum, to the Spanish Steps and Treve Fountain; we even walked back from the Vatican and the Borghese museum. The concierge was extremely helpful -- got us a guide for the vatican (which allowed us to avoid the longest line I've ever seen), tickets to the Borghese, train tickets for our next stop in Florence, in addition to taxis, etc. We will stay at the Minerve on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Choice - No downside”
Reviews.Author: parveen50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at Minerve in early August. Hotel was in the BEST location - 1 block behind Pantheon. Walking distance to everything. The area is basically all pedestrian and very lively and safe at night. I was there with my kids, aged 4 and 11 - and felt safe Staff all spoke some English - they were very helpful - from the chambermaid who helped when my son locked his key in a drawer - to the concierge who ordered taxis for us. Only flaw was that the maids forgot to clean our room one day - but that was fixed with a quick phone call. I wanted to stay near the Pantheon because of the location - and thought about Albergo del Senato - but in the end, I booked through skoosh.com - and the rate I was quoted was only 30 Euros more per night than the Senato - so I went with the 5 star. By the way - I can't say enough good things about skoosh.com. They are a british travel website - and were terrific because they actually answer the phone when you call..! The room itself was very spacious - and spotless. The breakfast was terrific - cereals, pastires, croissonts, etc. coffee and tea - and eggs, bacon, toast, etc. It was totally first class!! I would definitely stay there again! Also - we booked airport transportation through "romeshuttlelimousine.com" - They were wonderful - very efficient, courteous drivers who arrived early!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: steamroller1980
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. spacious rooms, large beds nice foyer. Right behind panethon close to large number of restaurants. turn right and right again for internet cafe Trevi fountain, spanish steps are within walking distance. Colusseum within half an hour walk, vatican about 5 euros in taxi but still walkable. Taxi to hotel from airport 30-40 euro. Taxi to train station 10 euro. The best ice cream shop in the world close by called della palma and the 2 best coffee shops in rome are in the piazza sant eustacchio according to roman people. very good would recommend hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “True Grand Hotel on excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MOZBOB
Reviews.Content: This hotel breathes the atmosphere of true grand old lady as soon as you enter the lobby. Front desk staff is very efficient and check-in is done within a few minutes. The rooms have a good size and are furnished traditionally with a very spacious bathroom. Everything appeared clean and the rooms had everything you would expect from a 5-star hotel in Rome. As soon as you leave the hotel you are in the center of everything, right next to the Pantheon and close to Piazza Navona. Everything from the hotel is in reasonable walking distance, which makes this a perfect location. The Vatican is a 15 to 20 minute stroll, Via Condotti and the Colosseum are probably about 20 – 30 minutes walk away. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation and also go back when in Rome again. I can’t comment on the breakfast, as we did not have breakfast in the hotel. We decided to simply have a croissant and coffee somewhere on a terrace, so that we keep room for a nice Italian lunch. PS: For transportation we used romecabs.com (booked directly via email) and everything was perfect: good cars, english speaking drivers and promptly on time

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service at a Price”
Reviews.Author: Livinit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week. Great location and nice view of the Plaza Minerve. Could not keep the windows open at night, because the street sweepers come every night (tourist area) and they are very Loud. Service was good. This is not a large hotel, it is fairly small and quaint. Gym was very small, the delux room we had was large for european standards. If I had to stay again, I would not stay in this hotel for a week, a few days would have been better. And then I would have stayed on the coast somewhere. This is a very expensive hotel, and you pay for the location which is a very "touista" area that gets old after while.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: strengthcoach
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome, having stayed at the “Hotel Grand Minerve”. We stayed for 6 nights, in room 459. Our travel party consisted of me, my wife, our 5 year old, and 11 month old. Hotel: Location, Location, Location. We visited Rome for the first time, so we were unsure as to the distance between the sites. We picked this hotel primarily because of its location, and for the size of the room that we could book. The location is incredible. As mentioned before, the hotel sits about 50 yards from the Pantheon, on a relatively quiet piazza. We were able to see much of “tourist” Rome without ever taking a taxi. From the Bourghese Park above Spanish Steps, down past the Collesium and across the river to the Vatican and Trastevere, we walked everywhere. The hotel map was more than sufficient to navigate everything. The actual room was about what we thought it would be. It was a “king” bed – two beds really just pushed together – along with a sitting room with a pull-out queen bed. Mornings were fabulous out on the deck – we had a deck with a table, 4 chairs, and two chaise lounges. Not many of the rooms had this feature, but it was worth it! The bathroom was OK, but they use shower curtains instead of glass doors. Bathroom was of adequate size. Did not watch TV (although there were 2 flat screens) or use the mini bar or room service…We did eat at the $30 euro buffet several times – it’s not easy getting two small kids out to eat early; for us the convenience was worth it. Also, the hostess never charged us for our kids, so it really wasn’t that bad… Service was good. Restaurant service was good, and pleasant. Lots of interaction with the kids. Concierge was also good, and did a decent job of recommending restaurants (more on that later). They took care of the “little” things, like weather reports, having the hotel umbrellas ready, etc. Is the property a little worn? Certainly. However, it looked in better shape than most others that we looked at while there. Quite frankly, there wasn’t much in Rome that wasn’t a little worn (more on that later too). Would we stay there again? If we had to stay in the center of Rome, we would. The central location is that important to us. However, if we return to Rome, we might try to stay further away from Rome’s center, to avoid some of the more “touristy” things going on… The City: Sorry Rome. The first thing that comes to mind is filthy,filthy,filthy. Rome was a giant ashtray with trash strewn about. I understand that the eternal city is old. I understand that soot and ash from cars and trucks will happen. What I don’t understand is the apparent lack of pride that many Italians have in their beautiful city. Everywhere we walked, we were literally stepping over dozens of cigarette butts, old newspapers, and various food wrappers. My 5 year old kept wondering why people were throwing the trash on the street and on the parks! Tourists, I’m sure, are responsible for some of this, but Rome needs to do a better job of cleaning itself up. Food:Surprisingly poor in the center of Rome. ( With the exception of gelato. That was usually good) We mistakingly were under the impression that any corner trattoria would have great food. (Previously, we took 3 trips to the UK, and had a hard time NOT finding a good meal). The center of Rome had many, many, lousy (how can Italians get pasta wrong?) restaurants, with service to match. In our first 7 meals in Rome, our order was wrong on the bill, with each restaurant trying to put things on the check that we did not have! In addition, some of my favorite tricks were 1. Seating charge. (yes, charging you to actually sit and eat) 2. Bread charge – per person.(ex. “bread, 2 Euro” means 2 Euro PER PERSON) 3. Charge regular price for things that are modified. (ex. – our son wanted a non-alcoholic drink at Harry’s. The regular price (with alcohol) was 14.50 Euros. We ordered a non-alcoholic version, and were still charged 14.50 Euros!. We then ordered (at Harry’s) a small plate (saucer size) of pasta – plain – no sauce, oil, butter – nothing – and were charged full price for a shrimp pasta special – 38 Euros! Then, of course, they tried to charge us for something else that we did not order…) That lunch at Harry’s did us in. We decided to only walk outside the center – down to Trastevere – or get specific recommendations from the Concierge. The meals instantly got better, and we finished the trip with several excellent meals. Sites: There are too many to mention. We were not disappointed by any sites or churches. Just alot yourself (as we luckily did) a great deal of time for the Vatican museums and the Collesium. Other: We chose not to bring a stroller to Rome because we thought the streets might not be paved well for them. We were right. Go with a back carrier or a wrap. You’ll get quite a workout as well!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and impressive, but probably a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Lazzer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (just moments from the Pantheon and lots of interesting little shops and great places to eat) and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had booked 2 rooms - one for someone in a wheelchair. The 'disabled' room was bigger but apart from that no different (no raised toilet seat, no walk in shower etc) so beware if you are a wheelchair user. There is lift access and helpful staff though. The hotel is impressive - large and beautiful, if a little dated. We didn't choose to eat or drink there but might have done if the rooftop terrace had been open (though again I don't think there is direct access other than walking up the last flight of steps to the top so again not as accessible as it could be for all). The rooms were very clean, and quiet (we stayed at the back) and large. Lovely large bathtowels and big bath and shower. The bed was nice and firm and possibly a queen. The staff always called a taxi for us when we needed and were generally helpful. It is quite expensive for what you get but a great location -and we did bump into Douglas Hurd in the lift - scary!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Scrapster
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and several work colleagues and their partners were treated to a weekend in Rome by work! All the reviews are correct. It is a little old fashioned in parts and very expensive. 20 Euros for a large Ammaretto! Would I pay with my own money to stay here, yes probably for the location but I am sure there are slightly more reasonable places to stay in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Experience in Roma”
Reviews.Author: MyEnzo1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Hotel La Minerve in Rome was a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly, helpful and went the extra mile for you. We received a quote by phone and they confirmed it by email. They followed through on the price and location of the room just as promised. We arrived at the hotel at about 9:00 AM and by 11:00 AM were in our room taking a shower! The size of the room, bathroom and facilities were tremendous for a European hotel. A great value on all ends. The location at Piazza del Minerve was ideal as it is in the center of Rome. I highly recommend this hotel. There is not a bad thing I can say. Bravo to the staff! Janine New York

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a Beautiful Room and View”
Reviews.Author: harryandnina
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a cruise of the Italian Riviera and a 3 night stay in Rome. We were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary and wanted the trip to be memorable. We spent months planning this trip and found the reviews that were posted on Trip Advisor to be very helpful. We selected the Grand Hotel de la Minerve because of its location and the reviews that we read on this site played a role in our decision. We were not disappointed in our selection. This hotel is walking distance from all the sites we wanted to see and allowed us to enjoy Rome on our own by just walking and taking in the sites and the people and their way of living. We arrived at the hotel early and the room we had requested was not ready and would not be ready for several hours. We left our luggage with the consierge and headed out for some sight seeing and lunch. You don't have to go far from the hotel to begin to experience the sites and the history of this fabulous city. The Panthenon is a block away from the hotel with its beautiful fountain and busy Piazza. Just outside the Hotel entrance is a beautiful church with a statue by Michelangelo inside. After a few hours of taking in the sights and fantastic lunch at a local trattoria we returned to the hotel to find that our room was still not ready. This was because we had requested a particular room and the people were late checking out. It was worth the wait! We requested Room 530 based on information we had read from another reviewer on this site. We were not disappointed. The room was a large suite with a great view of the Piazza de la Minerve. By any standards this was a spacious room and for what we have seen in hotels in Rome it was HUGE! This room is right next to the elevator but do not let this stop you from requesting this room. We were never bothered. My wife loved the big walk-in closet and the large bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. The only complaint we had was the mattress was hard as a rock and did not live up to the rest of the room. It was bearable only because we did so much walking during the day that we were exhausted when we got back to the room and could have slept on the floor and still fallen asleep! We cannot comment on the food at the hotel because we never ate there. You cannot go more than block or two without running into a variety of different restaurants, In addition the prices at the hotel restaurant were 10 times higher than what you could find just by walking down the street. The staff at the hotel was attentive and helpful, but this is what you should expect at a 5 star hotel. The hotel offered a breakfast buffet each morning for 30 euro each! We walked about 10 minutes away and found a great little place for a cappuccino and homemade pastry for two for 8 euro. You can also walk to the Cafe St Eustachio in the Piazza St Eustachio which has the reputation for the best expresso in all of Rome. It was OK but I don't know if I would call it the best. Overall we were very satisfied with our experience at this hotel and would return and stay there again. The location is fantastic and you pay the price for it. The service was excellent and the room fantastic. If you ask for Room 530 I do not think you will be disappointed. If you decide to stay in Rome get yourself some comfortable walking shoes, a good map and head off to experience this fantastic city and its ancient history. The city, the shopping, the people and the food are truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SisiWortham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve in June 2006. We had superior double room and a deluxe double room (which was the bigger room of the two we had). The rooms were clean and well appointed. They are fairly modern, and do not have an "old world" feel. They were streamlined with clean lines. The bathroom in the deluxe double room was much smaller than the bathroom in our superior double (the smaller room). The rooms and bathrooms are not luxurious, but they are clean. I would have expected a little more for what we spent on the rooms (over 400 and 500 euros a night!). The location is right next to the Pantheon, which is great. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the Forum and a few minutes past that is the Colosseum. The Piazza Navona is only about 10 minutes away as well. The hotel staff was helpful in arranging our transportation, dinner reservations and tour guides. But, our tour guide was not the best. He was very hard to hear and not very interesting. The roof of the hotel has a great view of the city. We did not eat there, but you have to go see the view if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure...”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingTaxman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Hotel de la Minerve in June 2006, for the business part (i.e. expense account!!!) of a trip to Rome. On the other nights I stayed at the Hotel Astrid (see review) and the Rome Hilton (see review). The Grand Hotel is unbelievably well located, literrally one minute away from the Pantheon. This is its greatest asset, of course. The staff was generally pleasant if a little snobbish, as you would expect from a grand luxury hotel. The rooftop terrace was nice also. The meeting rooms were more than adequate for the 40 or so people that we had in there. For the price (385euros/night double, 305euros/night single) the room was somewhat of a disappointment. Average in size, with a decent bathroom, they were very "plain" and didn't have anything unique. They were however functional and clean. For that kind of money, however, I would have expected to be "wowed".

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cristab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful Hotel for 3 night before visiting Siena and Florence. We loved this Hotel!! This was the best we encountered on our travels through Rome. I would highly recommend this to anyone! WONDERFUL location!! The staff was very friendly and the area was by far the best. The rooftop bar and restaurant is amazing with the best views of the city The room was a Double delux room with king bed and had lots of room and was very clean. I read other reviews about the beds being horrible but we did not find that to be a problem. The beds in Europe are just different from the US and anyone who has traveled through Europe would know that!! Anyways...LOVED LOVED LOVED The Minerve!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanVM
Reviews.Content: As many people have noted, this location is just the best. We first had a room that looked out on the piazza and the back of the Pantheon is right THERE! We were able to walk everywhere. There is an interesting issue in Rome which I was not aware of before this stay. Our room overlooking the piazza was very noisy at night..there is a lot of activity on that piazza. When we closed the windows the room became very warm. The front desk said that they were not allowed to turn on the air conditioning until June!! They said it is this way all over Rome. They said we could relocate to a room facing an interior courtyard or they would bring a fan. We decided to change rooms and this worked out much better for us. We did love that view on the piazza, but we loved getting a good night sleep better. The other issue is that there was no breakfast included with the room and it would have been quite expensive to add....I think it was something like 20E per person. We did know this coming in and were prepared to go out.....a very good coffee place St. Eustachio's very nearby. Our tour guide said it was one of the best coffee places in Rome. I was very happy with our stay and would stay again....in an interior room....unless it was air-conditioning season:)

Reviews.Title: “reservation system not reliable, be aware!!”
Reviews.Author: ILCAPITANOFELICE
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I booked three nights at this hotel as a treat for my wife. It was a wonderful hotel and even in winter, for breakfast was no problem at all. The location is so convenient and I had no problem in using the concierge service for informations. Everything was as easy as possible. When leaving, the concierge at the booked our taxi, arranged to have our luggage loaded and called us when it was all ready - to escort us to the taxi. This level of service at those prices was truly excellent. My one small gripe (and this will stop me going back) is that when we arrived, I found out that there were two reservations on my name and before leaving the hotel I was asked to pay for one extra night as non-show penalty (250 euros ). Humiliating and annoying for me. I made the reservation throughout hotel-invest but when i tried to amend the reservation the system generated two reservations. The hotel-invest , along with the Hotel Minerva certainly not send an emal to verify the “doubtful” double booking. In this "five" star Hotel the computer come before the guest, seemingly the reception of the hotel have no authority to cancel or sort erroneous bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Can not be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving 2005 in this hotel. The location, environment, and members are definitely excellent. In comparison with the top of line hotels in London and Paris, Hotel Minerve is just simple outstanding. What else? There is a small pizza restaurant 100 feet from our hotel and along the east side of Pantheon. Their pizza is the best that we had in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon in rome-dont eat in the roof top restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 6 nights in november . The suite was fantastic. The dinner in the dining room was excellent but the first night was spoilt.The roof terrace has a wondeful view but the maitre d was extremely rude.Did not eat in the hotel after the first night. walking distance form all the main sites in rome-no need for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but.......”
Reviews.Author: dwinpenn
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel De La Minerve is in one of the best locations you could possibily get in Rome - next door to the Pantheon within easy walking distance of most of the interesting sites in Rome. BUT, the hotel does itself have some issues. We arrived on a Saturday evening to stay for 1 week - the hotel did NOT have a reservation for us. When they checked it appeared that the reservation was recieved but NOT actioned. We were placed in another (lower class) room and the best offer we got was free breakfast. When we finally got to our real room on Sunday it was next to the Service area for the 4th floor (we were in 443!) and all night and day there was banging and crashing as people worked in the service area. The roof top restaurant is a fantastic location for a romantic dinner but the menu within the hotel is very limited. Staying for 1 week means that you will have easily exhausted the menu - in fact, it was so limited that we could only eat in the restaurant 2 times. Staff at the hotel are very helpful although do need to be pushed when there are issues aka no room reservation, to come a solution. Would we stay there again? Maybe, but certainly with a more detailed check of what room we would be placed in.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Grand Hotel De La Minerve and Location!”
Reviews.Author: italianwantobe
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and a group of other mother/daughters stayed at the Minerve for three nights in July. We had such a wonderful experience. We had a wonderful package that included breakfast as well as a fabulous 3 course dinner on their roof-top restaurant. The food, service and view was incredible. I was not prepared to love Rome as much as I did. I'm sure much of it had to do with having a wonderfully spacious room to kick back in. We loved the Location. We walked most places but also took cabs to save some time. One plus was also a drawback with the location. Since we were a large group (about 20) we had a large coach between cities, the streets around the Minerve are very narrow (quaint) and it was impossible to get our bus to the front of the hotel. The front desk did not inform us of this problem prior to our arrival. The evening that we arrived it was very chaotic trying to arrange our own transportation from the train station where our bus had to drop us off. Fortunatley things worked out and we were able to manage our own transportation to the hotel. (on the last day of a city wide taxi strike!) Our room on the 4th floor overlooked the back of the Pantheon and a quaint courtyard. Our room was very clean and well appointed. Our maid was the sweetest woman. The bellmen were very warm and the concierge bent over backwards to help accomodate our American hair appliances.(Important when travelling with daughters!) The one area that could use improvement is the front desk. They definitely did not posess the same gracious manor as the rest of the staff. That said we would still recommend and stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location, but it stops there. the service is not up to standards. the front desk does not care and good luck getting a bell hop to take your bags. the front desk knows you are a tourist so they just want you in and out. when i was there, the air conditioning in my room was not working, it took 3 trips to try and getit fixed and it still didnt work. they did nothing for me , other than to say , oh we will check into it. can you imagine this happening at a hotel in the us that charges $400 per night. i dont think so.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel/perfect location, other Rome tips”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome on 9/18/05. The Minerve is an outstanding hotel, 5 star staff - reception desk, concierge, and bell staff all included - and I'm very picky about hotels. We booked a deluxe queen room for fear of the tiny rooms we had heard about in Europe - it was a suite! All one big room, but suite non-the-less, with king size bed (not a queen), and the entry hallway and closet provided nice insulation against elevator noise - we never heard it and we were right next to it. Windows also shut tightly and completely eliminated street noise at night - individual A/C thermostat in room, so we stayed nice and cool. The deluxe rooms are huge, with nice sized bathroom, all marble, and jacuzzi tub (which was so wonderful after all-day walking). We were in room 530, looking out over the Piazza de Minerva and had a nice view of the Pantheon. Right next door is a beautiful Catholic church (Santa Maria Sopra Minerva) with amazing art and a statue by Michaelangelo (Masses at 8am & 6pm). The rooftop restaurant, Le Cesta, is lovely with great views of the city. We opted for a package that turned out to be quite economical - deluxe room, breakfast each morning (choice of full American buffet downstairs or continental in your room), and one 3 course dinner for two at Le Cesta, for about 495 euros a night. Also a "welcome drink" at the lobby bar, but not your choice of drink; sparkling wine or soft drink, although they let me have an espresso instead. Package price sounds high, but not for this particular room, and breakfast would have run us 31 euros per person if we'd payed separately, plus the lovely dinner (4-5 star) we enjoyed on the rooftop would've easily cost us 300USD. Tips: Don't buy water or drinks at the little outdoor stands; there's a supermarket off the Piazza Rotunda (Via Gustnani, I think?) and the deluxe rooms have mini-friges. Long lines at the supermarket, but they move fast. There's also a wine shop with great prices on the street that runs between the hotel and the church - 31 euros for a bottle of my favorite super tuscan that costs $60 at home, and a 9 euro bottle that was also quite good. We ended up enjoying a late breakfast (buffet serves til 10:30am) and not being hungry at lunchtime, so we just kept site-seeing til dinner. You can eat a casual dinner for as little as 5 euros for pizza for two at a little Pizzeria around the corner toward the Pantheon (wonderful!). I don't recommend any of the outdoor cafes on the major piazzas close to the hotel for a nicer dinner - pricey and not great quality. But step around the corner from any of the piazzas and find authentic Italian (house wines are excellent!) for the same price or less. Try one on the street (they're more like alleys than streets) that leads from the north end of the Piazza Navonna to the Trevi Fountain - it has a walkway of flat paving stones set in the middle of the cobblestones; we called it the "yellow brick road" becauase it's so easy to follow and leads straight to the Trevi. Best authentic Italian dinners for best prices are in Trastavere (full dinner for 3, with wine, for 43 euros), an area that seemed to be as populated with Italians as with tourists. Shopping was better on Via Cola de Rienze (out by the Vatican, just east of museum) than on the pricey streets like the Via Corso, Condotti, and the designer shops on the Vitorio Veneto. The Cola de Rienze shops seemed to be more frequented by the locals and had excellent quality clothing and other items. After shopping, try taking the boat taxi (1 euro per person!) from Pont Castel Sant Angelo (dock is opposite of river from the Castle) down the river to Trastavere for dinner. Great cafes all around the Santa Maria en Trastavere church, or cross the river and check out the fresh market in Campo di Fiori, then stop in at one of the cafes on that piazza - La Carbonara is right on the piazza and is great with reasonable prices. Also, the fresh fruit is Rome in beyond compare to anything in the U.S. - grown just 30 min. outside the city and picked at the peak of ripeness. Wonderful city, fantastic hotel, wonderful sites, great food - just bring well-worn-in walking shoes, cause the metros are useless (not like Paris; too few trains, not enough stops, and never seem to go where you want to go)and the buses are crowded. Rome is very compact; we walked from the hotel to the Vatican and from the hotel to the Colosseum/Forum - it is never as far as it looks on the map. Plus with all that walking, you can eat anything you want and never gain an ounce!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and its surroudings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel based on our travel agent and trip advisor. It was wonderful. It is kind of pricey with the exchange rate, but to roll out of the front door and see the back of the Pantheon cannot be beat. EVeryone was very helpful, especially the doorman, who spoke to my husband's aunt who lives in Rome for us since our Italian is poor. The rooms have got to be some of the biggest in Europe. I was really impressed. THe only downfall was that there was no breakfast included as in some of the reviews. That was ok in our book becuase there are plenty of coffee bars nearby where you can get some cappucino and a pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Good location..but have stayed in better hotels”
Reviews.Author: CanastaHotel
Reviews.Content: At 300 gbp per night I was expecting something a bit more than I got. OK...we had a suite with a private patio (which had broken plastic furniture by the way). The room was...OK....I have stayed in a suite in Bangkok for 50gbp per night that was ten times better than this (yeah OK Bangkok is a lot cheaper than Rome but...the room was like being in a palace) The concierge was surly and unhelpful...I just didn't feel comfortable...or at least not as comfortable as I should have felt for 350gbp per night...let's face it...I should have been treated like a freaking king for that!! But never got a good morning from anybody. Getting a smile out of the staff was hard enough. Didn't try the breakfast at 30 euros each sounded a bit too much - went to nearby square for fresh fruit brekkie every day. Tried the restaurant one night - meal was FANTASTIC and the staff theremuch more amenable. The hotel is well situated for anywhere...it must be the perfect location. Would I go back there - not after way I was treated.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular surprise”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLibraryLady
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17-year-old daughter, and I just returned from an 11-day tour of Italy with one of the major tour companies. Our group was originally scheduled to stay at the Crowne Plaza but was moved to this hotel because of overbooking. We couldn't have been more pleased. Like so many of the hotels in Italy, this one isn't that impressive on the outside, but, unlike many of the others, it is just gorgeous on the inside. The three of us were amazed to find ourselves in a large suite. We had two fullsize beds in our room and the couch in the outer room folded out to a very comfortable bed, allowing our daughter to have a room of her own. Both rooms had televisions (though I can't say much about Italian television choices). The bathroom was very large by European standards and, happily, the shower had a shower curtain. The room was beautifully and tastefully decorated. The breakfast in the restaurant was good and included fresh fruit. The other big advantage of this hotel is the location. It is literally right next to the Pantheon and easily accessible to the major attractions in Rome. Restaurants (and gelatto places) are nearby. After starting our tour with two nights in this hotel, all the other hotels were a real comedown. I'd definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Rome around........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the Minerva for 3 nights and thought it was the best location to see all of the sites of Rome by walking. We had a great suite on the 6th floor. The roof bar gave a great view of the Pantheon as well as many other sites , though a bit pricey for cocktails. I would highly recommend this hotel for people looking to be in the center of it all with great service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Staff was very helpful. I saw an earlier review about lack of breakfast but we had breakfast every morning and it was included in our rate. Our room was large and very nice. Best thing about this hotel is the location. It is central to everywhere in Rome. We hired a guide through the hotel. His name is Antonio Paladino. His English is very good and he did a great job showing us around. He added a lot of color and interest to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs in case you get one of the noisy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: hutchy22
Reviews.Content: Take your ear plugs if you stay at this hotel on the weekend and end up with a room over the Plazza side. Rome stays up quite late on weekends and people and traffic make noise till 3:00am! We stayed at this hotel two times. The first time we stayed there we had a room that faced the quiet side. It was great! Unfortunately we payed the same high price for a room on the noisy side the second time and had a hard time sleeping for our early morning flight. The hotel could not move us to the quiet side as all those quiet rooms are taken first! The hotels location is awsome, the rooms are clean and the interior is elegant but if you can't sleep the rooms sure aren't worth the $370 euros per night. So be aware that rooms on the quiet side of the hotel are taken first, especially on weekends! Also, I found the front desk staff a little stuffy ab bit rude under pressure and not all that helpful. The roof top bar/restraurant is worth going up for a night cap, but when we ate at the restaurant we found older grey haired Maitre Di to be quite rude and arrogant! The rest of the staff were much freindlier and almost made up for his abruptness. All and all I would have to say that the rooms at the Grand Minerve vary quite a bit so be careful and state "QUIET ROOM ONLY" on your booking if you stay over a weekend! Otherwise bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but...”
Reviews.Author: CFISH57
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, as everyone says--also the rooftop restaurant is to die for (gorgeous view, friendly smooth service, and delicious food), service is courteous, and the lobby is lovely. However, we stayed at a crowded time and had booked through the internet and were quite disappointed with the room itself. Though reasonable in size, it had not been renovated and looked nothing like the pictures on the website-more like a Holiday Inn, with a dark interior view, which at $450 plus per night is disappointing. We offered to pay extra for a better room, but were told none were available, even though we were booked for four nights. So, if you go at peak season, don't count on an upgrade, and I would check other hotels in the same area rather than reserving the standard room here. Then go eat in the rooftop restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with suberb sevice throughout.”
Reviews.Author: Robinson-Byrne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome 1st May 2005 after a 4 night stay at the Grand Hotel Minerve and it was superb. It was my first visit to Rome and was not sure what to expect of the hotels etc but after seeing what the other hotels had to offer I know I made the right choice. Our first room was small and not suitable for our needs and had an awful view, so after seeing the manageress, who was wonderful, we were give a junior suite at no extra cost which was just amazing. I took my elderly mother along with my sister and we had 1st class treatment from start to finish. Our room was fantastic with views of the Pantheon and the surrounding area, the chuch outside the hotel is breathtaking inside. The staff in this hotel were so helpful right from the manager down to the housekeepers, they could not do enough for you. You must have lunch or dinner on the rooftop this was the best part of our day, we would have lunch and then sit in the sun and relax for a while before going back out to see more sights. My mum has limited mobility and this hotel was absolutely no problem to her in any way. I can only say that this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in throughout the world. If I have any citicism at all it would be about the breakfast, they could do better, there was lots of friut and cereals but very little choice of hot food and breads, but everything else in the hotel made up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, weak on hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location, right in the backyard of the Pantheon. The rooms were very nice, and the bar and complimentary breakfast were perfect. Our only complaint was the lack of hospitality shown by upper management. We were told by the staff, and had read in the informational booklet that they provided, that the roof garden would be open. When it was not, we asked the concierge to be allowed to speak with the manager about this. After pressing him several times, he finally relented and let us speak with her. She did not offer any apology for the signs and error of her employees, and insisted that the garden not being open for drinks was due to the short rain the night before (it had rained for 15 minutes). In actuality, they were doing a photo shoot on the roof that day, and she lied to cover up their misrepresentations. The hotel is perfect if you are staying on business; if you are traveling for pleasure, it is good, but do not expect much in the way of hospitality from the management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned. Impeccable service, best location in town, beautiful rooms with every amenity. Fabulous breakfast buffet. What a treat.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel de la Minerve
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza della Minerva 69, 00186 Rome, Italy
